      3.   For leaving the scene of an accident or failing to report the same
as required by law;
      4.   For permitting any other person to use his/her license;
      5.   For altering any portion of his/her license;
      6.   Upon conviction of a third traffic violation within the same year
pertaining to speeding in excess of ten (10) miles per limit, reckless driving,
careless driving, improper turn, defective equipment, backing around corners or
into an intersection, nonobservance of traffic signals and signs, or any
combination of said offenses.
   B.   A taxicab/limousine driver's license may be suspended by the chief of
police for the first and second offense traffic violations of the nature
specified in subsection A6 of this section or for repeated infractions of minor
traffic rules, for a period of time not to exceed ninety (90) days.
   C.   Provided, the licensed driver shall have the right to appeal to the
license review board from any suspension or revocation imposed by this chapter,
but shall not operate a taxicab/limousine until the revocation is vacated or
suspension is set aside on appeal. The license review board shall consider the
revocation hearing within at least fifteen (15) days after such revocation or
suspension is imposed. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.28.140: CONTINUOUS SERVICE REQUIRED:
In addition to existing requirements relating to the operation of taxicabs
within the corporate limits of the city, it shall hereafter be the duty of all
persons, firms or corporations licensed to operate taxicabs within the city to
continuously have available for call and operating on the streets of the city
at least one taxicab on a twenty four (24) hour basis. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.28.150: EQUIPMENT REQUIRED:
All taxicabs within the city shall be required to be radio controlled. It shall
be the duty of the licensee to provide a radio dispatcher and adequate radio
transmission facilities to remotely call and dispatch taxicabs on a twenty four
(24) hour basis at or to any point within the corporate limits of the city. The
office of the dispatcher shall be equipped with standard telephone facilities
that permit persons residing within the city to telephonically call for taxicab
service. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.28.160: LICENSE; CAUSE FOR SUSPENSION:
Failure to comply with any of the provisions of this chapter shall, in addition
to the grounds listed in sections
5.28.110 and 5.28.130 of this chapter, constitute cause for suspension of any
taxicab/limousine license, issued by the city for a period of time not to
exceed ninety (90) days for any one violation, by the chief of police of the
city, or revocation thereof subject to right of appeal therefrom. (Ord. 1931 §
2, 2009)
CHAPTER 5.30
TRANSIT SYSTEMS
SECTION:
5.30.010: Definitions
5.30.020: License; Required
5.30.030: Inspection Required
5.30.040: License; Fees
5.30.050: Application; Contents; Title Certificate Display
5.30.060: Application; Hearing
5.30.070: Liability Insurance Required
5.30.080: Designation
5.30.090: Rate Schedule
5.30.100: Unlawful Acts; Grounds For Revocation
5.30.110: Driver's License; Nontransferable
5.30.120: Driver's License; Revocation Or Suspension
5.30.130: License; Cause For Suspension
5.30.010: DEFINITIONS:
LIMOUSINE: When used in this chapter, a chauffeur driven vehicle for hire,
designed to accommodate seven (7) or more passengers excluding the chauffeur,
classified by the manufacturer as a limousine or stretched to accommodate more
passengers than in its original design, which is contracted for in advance and
operated on a fixed fare basis.
TRANSIT SYSTEM: Shall include any system utilizing motor vehicles for hire, in
which at least seventy percent (70%) of said vehicles in service are designed
to carry fourteen (14) persons or more, operated upon any street or highway,
whether on call or on demand or using regular routes on a published schedule,
and accepting or soliciting passengers indiscriminately for transportation for
hire between points along streets or highways. This classification shall not
include: a) taxicabs or limousines, b) funeral and ambulance vehicles, c) motor
vehicles transporting students to or from the public school system when under
contract or employment with a public, private, or parochial school board or
comparable governing body, or d) motor vehicles operated by the owner where the
cost of operation is shared by fellow workers between their homes and place or
regular daily employment if not operated for more than two (2) trips per day.
(Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.30.020: LICENSE; REQUIRED:
No person, firm or corporation, or any owner, agent, employee or driver shall
operate or permit to be operated a transit system within the city limits,
unless the proper city license has been issued to the owner thereof and the
person operating the vehicle has been licensed under the provisions of this
chapter. Provided that any transit system that is licensed or permitted by the
Oklahoma department of transportation or the federal transit administration or
the Muscogee (Creek) Nation shall be exempt from the requirements to acquire a
city license. (Ord. 2029, 2014)
5.30.030: INSPECTION REQUIRED:
Each vehicle shall be inspected by the chief of police or the chief's designee
before a license or renewal of license shall be issued for such vehicle, to
ensure that each has the proper safety/operating equipment required by this
code and state law. Provided that the designee may rely on inspection by the
Muscogee (Creek) Nation, or the Oklahoma department of transportation or the
federal transit administration, or comparable state or national agency. (Ord.
2029, 2014)
5.30.040: LICENSE; FEES:
If not licensed by the Muscogee (Creek) Nation, Oklahoma department of
transportation, the federal transit administration, or a comparable state or
national agency, then the city's license fee for each vehicle used within the
city shall be set by resolution of the city council and be payable on an annual
basis. Every such city license shall expire on June 30 next following its
issuance. Such license shall not be assignable nor the fee prorated. The
license fee shall be in addition to all other fees required by the state. (Ord.
2029, 2014)
5.30.050: APPLICATION; CONTENTS; TITLE CERTIFICATE DISPLAY:
   A.   If not licensed by the Oklahoma department of transportation or the
federal transit administration, or a comparable state or national agency, the
transit authority shall file a written application to operate a transit
service, by the owner of the vehicle or vehicles, or his agent, duly verified
and stating the following facts:
      1.   Name and address of applicant; if a partnership, the names and
addresses of all partners; if a corporation, the names and addresses of the
officers of the corporation;
      2.   Address of principal place of business;
      3.   Full description of each motor vehicle to be used including motor
and serial number, make and body style;
      4.   Trade name and identifying markings (if any) under which business
will be conducted and location of proposed stand(s) for the riders;
      5.   Proof of insurance on all vehicles in an amount not less than twenty
five thousand dollars' ($25,000.00) bodily injury coverage for one person,
fifty thousand dollars' ($50,000.00) bodily injury coverage for two (2) or more
persons in any one accident, and twenty five thousand dollars' ($25,000.00)
property coverage.
   B.   The state title certificate for each listed vehicle shall be displayed
at the time of application to the city. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.30.060: APPLICATION; HEARING:
Upon the filing of a city application with the city clerk, the same shall be
referred to the license review board for hearing. The license review board
shall consist of the chief of police, the city clerk, the fire marshal, the
public works director, and the building official. The chief of police shall
serve as chairman and the city clerk shall serve as secretary of said board.
Upon the receipt of an application, the city clerk shall call a meeting of the
license review board to pass upon said application at a date not to exceed
thirty (30) days from the date of the application. The city clerk shall cause
notice of said meeting to be posted at the city hall for at least ten (10) days
prior to said meeting date. The license review board shall, at the hearing,
grant license to the applicant if applicant shows by proper proof that public
convenience, necessity, and welfare requires such service, or additional
service, proposed to be rendered by the applicant, provided said applicant has
complied with all other requirements of this chapter. Provided further, that
the hearing shall not be required if a permit or license has been issued by the
Oklahoma department of transportation or the federal transit administration, or
a comparable state or national agency. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.30.070: LIABILITY INSURANCE REQUIRED:
For the duration of the license for any transit system, the owner shall
maintain and periodically file with the city clerk an insurance policy
providing liability insurance coverage for each and every vehicle owned, leased
or operated by him with a same or better coverage as specified in section
5.30.050 of this chapter, the coverage to be effective whether the transit
system vehicle was, at the time of accident, being used by the owner, his
agent, employee or any person with his consent. The insurance policy shall
further provide that the same cannot be canceled until ten (10) days' written
notice has been given to the city clerk of intention to cancel the same. Should
the insurance be canceled and the applicant fail to procure other insurance
within ten (10) days of the notice of cancellation, the license shall
terminate. The policy of insurance shall carry the name of the owner and model
and body style and motor or serial number of each vehicle so insured. The
policy shall provide for continuing liability thereunder notwithstanding any
recovery thereon and provide that until the policy is revoked upon notice to
the city clerk as provided in this chapter, the insurance company shall not be
relieved from liability for nonpayment of premiums, nor by virtue of insolvency
or bankruptcy of the insured. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.30.080: DESIGNATION:
Every person owning and operating a transit system under license from the city
shall have the words "transit system" or "transit authority" in at least two
inch (2") letters painted on each side and the rear thereof, unless such words
appear in the trade name thereof. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.30.090: RATE SCHEDULE:
Each operator of a transit system business under the provisions of this chapter
shall annually file with the city clerk a schedule of rates to be charged for
conveying passengers within the city, and it is unlawful to charge, collect or
receive any greater sum than the sum so stated; provided, further, that it is
not forbidden for the passenger to voluntarily give and the driver to receive a
tip in addition to the applicable rate. Such schedule of rates may be amended,
changed and refiled at any time during the year. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.30.100: UNLAWFUL ACTS; GROUNDS FOR REVOCATION:
It is unlawful and grounds for revocation of any transit system license issued
under the provisions of this chapter, for any licensee to do or permit any of
the following acts to be done:
   A.   Knowingly use any vehicle for the transportation of untaxed or
improperly taxed alcoholic beverages or cigarettes, or to facilitate
prostitution;
   B.   Misrepresent any fact stated in the application for license;
   C.   Commit an assault or deception in an attempt to collect more than the
established rate schedule;
   D.   Fail to obtain, furnish proof of, and maintain liability insurance
coverage as required by this chapter. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.30.110: DRIVER'S LICENSE; NONTRANSFERABLE:
Every person employed for the purpose of operating, or who does operate, a
transit system vehicle for hire within the city shall apply for a driver's
license for such purpose. The application shall include a copy of the
applicant's driving history obtained from the applicable state authority or a
tag office, and the applicant shall be subject to a background check to review
any criminal history. The application shall be filed with the city clerk,
together with the payment of the license fee as set by resolution of the city
council. Such license shall be issued upon proof of a reasonably safe driving
record, the lack of a criminal history involving intoxicants, criminal sexual
conduct, or violence. The license shall expire June 30 of each year, and shall
not be transferable. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.30.120: DRIVER'S LICENSE; REVOCATION OR SUSPENSION:
   A.   A transit system driver's license may be revoked by the chief for any
of the following causes:
      1.   Upon conviction or violation of any federal law or state law
pertaining to felonies or involving moral turpitude;
      2.   For operating a transit system vehicle in violation of the Oklahoma
alcoholic beverage control act, or under the influence of any intoxicants;
      3.   For leaving the scene of an accident or failing to report the same
as required by law;
      4.   For permitting any other person to use his/her license;
      5.   For altering any portion of his/her license;
      6.   Upon conviction of a third traffic violation within the same year
pertaining to speeding in excess of ten (10) miles per hour over the posted
limit, reckless driving, careless driving, improper turn, defective equipment,
backing around corners or into an intersection, nonobservance of traffic
signals and signs, or any combination of said offenses;
   B.   A transit system driver's license may be suspended by the chief of
police for the first and second offense traffic violations of the nature
specified in subsection A6 of this section or for repeated infractions of minor
traffic rules, for a period of time not to exceed ninety (90) days;
   C.   Provided, the licensed driver shall have the right to appeal to the
license review board from any suspension or revocation imposed by this chapter,
but shall not operate a transit system vehicle until the revocation is vacated
or suspension is set aside on appeal. The license review board shall consider
the revocation hearing within at least fifteen (15) days after such revocation
or suspension is imposed. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.30.130: LICENSE; CAUSE FOR SUSPENSION:
Failure to comply with any of the provisions of this chapter shall, in addition
to the grounds listed in sections
5.30.100 and 5.30.120 of this chapter, constitute cause for suspension of any
transit system license issued by the city for a period of time not to exceed
ninety (90) days for any one violation by the chief of police of the city, or
revocation thereof subject to right of appeal therefrom. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
CHAPTER 5.32
SALES OF MERCHANDISE IN PUBLIC
SECTION:
5.32.010: Sale Of Personal Property On Or In Vacant Property; Consent Required
5.32.020: Auctions Or Sales On Public Streets Or Sidewalks Unlawful; Exceptions
5.32.030: Obstructing Streets, Sidewalks; Exceptions
5.32.040: Sale Of Chemical Precursors To Methamphetamine Production
5.32.010: SALE OF PERSONAL PROPERTY ON OR IN VACANT PROPERTY; CONSENT REQUIRED:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation, including a civic or
religious organization, to sell, barter, trade or transfer any merchandise,
wearing apparel or other personal property of any kind on or in any vacant
property in the city without the consent of the owner or person in control of
the property. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.32.020: AUCTIONS OR SALES ON PUBLIC STREETS OR SIDEWALKS UNLAWFUL;
EXCEPTIONS:
It is unlawful for any person to hold any public or private auction for sale of
property on any of the streets or sidewalks of the city; provided, that this
section shall not apply to the sale of property under any lien, execution or
order of any court of the state or of the United States Of America. (Ord. 1931
§ 2, 2009)
5.32.030: OBSTRUCTING STREETS, SIDEWALKS; EXCEPTIONS:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to place upon or permit to
be placed upon the sidewalks, parkways, streets and alleys of the city any
goods, wares, articles or merchandise or any other obstructions, except that
any retailer of same operating a business in a commercial district may exhibit
and sell merchandise upon the sidewalks, parkways, streets and alleys of the
city directly adjacent to said retailer's business, if said retailer has
complied with the following conditions:
   A.   Said retailer has in full force and effect a policy of public liability
insurance in amounts at least equal to the amount prescribed for liability in
the Oklahoma political subdivisions tort claims act; and
   B.   Such goods, wares, or articles of merchandise shall be placed as near
to the building as possible and in no event shall same be placed or exhibited
within a distance of sixty inches (60") of the curb line.
Also see sections
12.16.050, "Interference With Pedestrians Or Traffic"; 12.16.060, "Depositing
Trash Or Refuse"; and 12.16.070, "Interference With Storm Sewers Or Drainage",
of this code. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.32.040: SALE OF CHEMICAL PRECURSORS TO METHAMPHETAMINE PRODUCTION:
   A.   Purpose: The council of the city of Okmulgee has found the manufacture,
transportation, possession and sale of methamphetamine and the byproducts and
wastes of methamphetamine production are inherently dangerous and injurious to
the public health, safety and welfare of the residents of the city. Further,
statistical evidence indicates that there exists an unusual concentration of
the sale or distribution of the chemical precursors to methamphetamine
production, such as ephedrine products and pseudoephedrine products, in an area
of northeastern Oklahoma, principally focused on Tulsa County and the counties
adjacent thereto which includes Okmulgee County. Regulation of the sale of the
chemical precursors to methamphetamine production, such as ephedrine products
and pseudoephedrine products, is necessary to protect the general public within
the city.
   B.   Prohibition Of Sale/Distribution Of Methamphetamine Precursor Drugs: It
shall be illegal for any person to sell, deliver, or distribute any ephedrine,
pseudoephedrine, their salts, their optical isomers, or salts of their optical
isomers, in a dry form whether in a solid tablet or powdered form without a
valid prescription issued by a duly licensed physician or supervised
physician's assistant and filled by an Oklahoma licensed pharmacist or pharmacy
technician. Provided that this prohibition shall not apply to any ephedrine,
pseudoephedrine compounds, mixtures, or preparations which are in liquid,
liquid capsule or gel capsule form.
   C.   Distribution By A Licensed Physician Or Physician's Assistant: Nothing
in this section shall prohibit the distribution of ephedrine, pseudoephedrine,
their salts, their optical isomers, or salts of their optical isomers in any
form by an Oklahoma licensed physician or physician's assistant within the
physician's office, or any clinic, nursing home or other properly licensed
healthcare facility upon the orders of said authority.
   D.   Prescriptions; Refills: No prescription issued pursuant to this section
shall be filled or refilled more than six (6) months after the date such
prescription was issued, and no such prescription authorized to be refilled may
be refilled more than five (5) times.
   E.   Penalty: Any person convicted of violating any of the provisions of
this section shall be punished by a fine as specified in section
1.12.010 of this code and costs. A separate offense shall be deemed committed
for each delivery, sale or distribution transaction. (Ord. 1974, 2011)
CHAPTER 5.34
RESIDENTIAL SALES
SECTION:
5.34.010: Residential Sale Defined
5.34.020: Exemption From Provisions
5.34.030: Permit; Required; Separate For Each Location
5.34.040: Permit; Application
5.34.050: Permit; Issuance
5.34.060: Permit; Revocation
5.34.070: Proceeds Subject To Sales Tax
5.34.080: Advertising Signs Or Devices Limited
5.34.090: Display Of Goods
5.34.100: Permit; Fee
5.34.110: Violation; Penalty
5.34.010: RESIDENTIAL SALE DEFINED:
Whenever used in this chapter, unless otherwise clearly indicated by the
context, the term "residential sale" means any sale held out to be, or commonly
known as, a garage, porch, room, back yard, front yard or patio sale, or any
other type of general sale conducted from or on any premises not located in a
zoning district which permits such sales where goods or articles of any type
are held out for sale to the public; provided, however, that this definition
shall not include a situation where specific items are held out for sale and
all advertisement of such sale specifically names the items to be sold. (Ord.
1931 § 2, 2009)
5.34.020: EXEMPTION FROM PROVISIONS:
The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to or affect the following
persons:
   A.   Persons acting pursuant to an order or process of a court of competent
jurisdiction;
   B.   Persons acting in accordance with their powers and duties as public
officials;
   C.   Civic or religious organizations holding sales to raise funds for their
organizations;
   D.   Persons or organizations participating in a "citywide garage sale"
sponsored by a local nonprofit organization and approved by the city council.
(Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.34.030: PERMIT; REQUIRED; SEPARATE FOR EACH LOCATION:
   A.   It is unlawful and an offense for any person to hold, conduct, engage
in or participate in any manner in a residential sale without having first
obtained a permit, as provided for in this chapter; provided, however, that the
issuance of a permit under the provisions of this chapter shall not exempt such
persons from the terms and provisions of any other ordinance of the city.
   B.   A separate permit shall be required for each location at which a
residential sale is to be held.
   C.   No permit shall be issued if three (3) residential sales have been held
or conducted at the location for which a permit is requested within the
calendar year. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.34.040: PERMIT; APPLICATION:
An applicant for a permit under the provisions of this chapter shall furnish
the city clerk with the following information:
   A.   Full name and address of applicant;
   B.   The location at which the proposed residential sale is to be held;
   C.   The date, or dates, upon which the sale shall be held;
   D.   An affidavit from the applicant to the effect that all goods to be sold
at the subject residential sale are owned by the applicant and have not been
obtained for the purpose of reselling the articles at the sale. (Ord. 1931 § 2,
2009)
5.34.050: PERMIT; ISSUANCE:
   A.   The city clerk is authorized to grant a permit for a residential sale
for a period not to exceed two (2) consecutive days to any person applying
therefor and who otherwise complies with the requirements of this chapter and
the other ordinances of the city; provided, however, that when a residential
sale is not held on the dates for which the permit is issued or is terminated
during the first day of such sale because of inclement weather conditions, and
an affidavit by the permit holder to this effect is submitted, the city clerk
may issue another permit to the applicant for a residential sale to be
conducted at the same location within thirty (30) days from the date when the
first sale was to be held.
   B.   Before issuing a residential sale permit, the city clerk may conduct
such investigation as may reasonably be necessary to determine if there is
compliance with this chapter and other ordinances of the city. (Ord. 1931 § 2,
2009)
5.34.060: PERMIT; REVOCATION:
Any permit issued under this chapter may be revoked, or any application for
issuance of such permit may be refused by the city clerk in the event the
ordinances of this city are not complied with or if the application submitted
by the applicant, or permit holder, contains any false, fraudulent, or
misleading statement. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.34.070: PROCEEDS SUBJECT TO SALES TAX:
All proceed from sales conducted under this chapter are subject to sales tax as
provided for by state law and title 3,
chapter 3.12 of this code. Permit holders are responsible for the proper
reporting of sales and this remittance of taxes. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.34.080: ADVERTISING SIGNS OR DEVICES LIMITED:
Not more than one sign or other device used for the purpose of advertising, or
otherwise calling attention to a residential sale, shall be allowed for each
residential sale permitted under this chapter. The sign or device shall be
located on the immediate premises where the sale is to be conducted, but in no
event shall the sign or device be more than two hundred feet (200') from the
sale area. The display surface of such sign or device shall not exceed twelve
(12) square feet on each side. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.34.090: DISPLAY OF GOODS:
The sale area at any residential sale shall be confined to the premises for
which the permit has been issued, and in no event shall articles or goods be so
displayed as to attract attention or be conspicuously in view from any public
street. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.34.100: PERMIT; FEE:
There is levied a fee of five dollars ($5.00) for a residential sale permit,
which shall be paid to the city clerk before issuance of said permit. (Ord.
1931 § 2, 2009)
5.34.110: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
Any person who conducts a residential sale without a permit as required in
section
5.34.030 of this chapter or violates any provision of this chapter shall be
guilty of an offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined as provided in
section
1.12.010 of this code. Violation of this chapter shall also be grounds for
revocation or suspension of permit granted. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
CHAPTER 5.36
ITINERANT VENDORS
SECTION:
5.36.010: Definitions
5.36.020: License Required
5.36.030: Application
5.36.040: Exemption
5.36.050: Registration And License Fees
5.36.060: Transfer
5.36.070: Going Upon Private Residences
5.36.080: Penalty
5.36.010: DEFINITIONS:
For the purpose of this chapter, the following terms shall have the meanings
respectively ascribed to them in this section:
FOOD TRUCK: As used in this chapter, means a mobile food service establishment
as defined by the Oklahoma Department of Health, and does not include mobile
retail food service establishment or push carts. Vendors qualifying as mobile
retail or push carts may operate on a temporary basis for designated events
under
chapter 5.08 of this title.
INTERSTATE COMMERCE: As used in this chapter, items or property from another
state which are consigned to any other state and eligible under the tariffs,
rules and regulations approved by the Interstate Commerce Commission as not
subject to taxation due to their temporary presence in this State.
ITINERANT VENDOR: All persons, firms or corporations, as well as their agents
and employees who engage in the temporary or transient business in the City of
selling or offering for sale any goods or merchandise, amusement or services,
or exhibiting the same for sale or exhibiting the same for the purpose of
taking orders for the sale thereof and who for the purpose of carrying on such
business or conduction of such exhibits thereof either hire, rent, lease or
occupy any room or space in any building, structure, other enclosure, vacant
lot or any other property whatever in the City in, through, or from which any
goods or merchandise may be sold, offered for sale or exhibited for the purpose
of taking orders for the sale thereof.
TEMPORARY: As used in the definition of "interstate commerce", any such
business transacted or conducted in the City for which definite arrangements
have not been made for the hire, rental or lease of premises for at least one
hundred (100) days, in or upon which such business is to be operated or
conducted.
TRANSIENT: As used in the definition of "itinerant vendor", any such business
of any such itinerant vendor as may be operated or conducted by persons, firms
or corporations, or by their agents or employees who reside away from the City
or who have fixed places of business in places other than the City or who move
stocks of goods or merchandise or samples thereof into the City with the
purpose or intention of removing them, or the unsold portion thereof, away from
the City before the expiration of one hundred (100) days.
An "itinerant vendor" which considers itself exempt from this chapter by reason
of being engaged in interstate commerce shall have the right to request a
hearing before the Community Development Department to determine the burden, if
any, imposed on the vendor by this chapter. (Ord. 2107, 2017: Ord. 2104, 2017:
Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.36.020: LICENSE REQUIRED:
It is unlawful for any itinerant vendor to sell, offer for sale, exhibit for
sale, or exhibit for the purpose of taking orders for the sale thereof, any
goods or merchandise in the City without first obtaining a license as herein
provided for. The City Clerk shall issue to each itinerant vendor a license
authorizing such individual itinerant vendor to sell, exhibit for sale, offer
for sale, or exhibit for the purpose of taking orders for the sale thereof in
the City his goods or merchandise only after such individual itinerant vendor
shall have fully complied with all provisions of this chapter and shall have
paid the license fees hereinafter provided, which sum shall be compensation to
the City for the services herein required of it and to enable the City to
partially defray the expenses of enforcing the provisions of this chapter. A
separate license is required for each individual itinerant vendor.
For food trucks, only one license is needed for each establishment, not each
employee onsite selling the food. (Ord. 2104, 2017: Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.36.030: APPLICATION:
Each individual itinerant vendor shall make application to the City Clerk of
the City prior to his contemplated sale or exhibit to be held in the City. The
application shall be in the form of an affidavit, stating the full name and
address of the itinerant vendor, the location of his or its principal office
and place of business, the names and addresses of its officers if it be a
corporation; or the partnership name and the names and addresses of all
partners if such itinerant vendor be a firm. The application thereof must be
accompanied by:
   A.   A statement showing the kind and character of goods to be sold, or
merchandise to be sold, offered for sale or exhibited;
   B.   A certified copy of the charter if the itinerant vendor be a
corporation, incorporated under the laws of this State. If the itinerant vendor
be a corporation, incorporated under the laws of some state other than
Oklahoma, a certified copy of authority to do business in this State;
   C.   A certified copy of its permit or authority to do business in the
State;
   D.   Driver's license or State issued photo identification card;
   E.   A copy of the business's State Sales Tax permit or proof that the
business is exempt from the payment of Sales Tax;
   F.   A written, notarized statement by the legal owner of the land upon
which any fixed outdoor business location shall be located authorizing the use
of the land for the purposes desired by the applicant;
   G.   A statement from the Okmulgee Community Development Department that the
location described in subsection F of this section will not create a traffic
hazard and provides adequate off street parking;
   H.   A restaurant license from the City of Okmulgee if the vendor is serving
food as part of an organized festival or City event.
      1.   Vendors for an organized fair carnival, circus, festival, public
exhibition, or similar gathering are covered under separate license under
chapter 5.08 of this title, itinerant food vendor, and regulated as part of
that event. Permits granted to food trucks under this paragraph are separate
from event permits and do not allow vendor to set up for organized events.
      2.   Food trucks may be permitted to operate at food court locations
designated by the City Manager or at such locations within the City upon
private property where they are at least sixty five feet (65') from any other
restaurant location and are not operating for more than two (2) days per
calendar week at the same location. A private location must comply with public
access and traffic regulations, and must provide waste receptacles for public
use, and comply with subsections F and G of this section.
      3.   Each applicant will be required to register their vendor's Oklahoma
Health Department license with the City before any City license will be issued.
The expiration date for the City registration will coincide with the expiration
date of their Oklahoma Health Department license for a mobile food truck. No
City license will be issued until the applicant has renewed their registration.
      4.   The food truck vendor must comply with all traffic laws and must
maintain a unit in good repair and sanitary condition, operate in a manner
which does not disturb the peace and enjoyment of the community and be self-
contained for all power, water, sanitation and food and non-food waste, and be
fully responsible for the independent location of disposal of grease and
wastewater.
      5.   A food truck vendor must maintain a current license from the
Oklahoma Department of Health and current Oklahoma Sales Tax permit at all
times under the City license, each of which must be prominently displayed along
with the City license hereunder obtained at the point of sale on the food
truck. A copy of the current Oklahoma health license and Sales Tax permit must
be presented at the time of application for a City license. If the Oklahoma
Sales Tax permit expires before the food truck registration expires, a current
copy must be presented before the applicant can apply for a new license.
      6.   The City Manager shall have the power to revoke, deny, suspend or
modify any applicant or licensee hereunder for violation of this chapter or any
other ordinance of City or violation of State law, or significant unresolved
complaints with regard to operation, cleanliness or sanitation.
      7.   Food truck courts will be designated locations open for operation
during specified days and hours. The sites will be open for set up
approximately five (5) hours before the start and five (5) hours after the end
of the operation hours and all trucks and any other property will need to be
removed on a daily basis. The City Manager reserves the right to limit the
number of food trucks per court date for reasons of limited space or public
safety.
      8.   Food truck licenses can be purchased for a two (2) day period in a
calendar week, per site and the City may take up to five (5) business days to
approve the license. The City reserves the right to limit the number of
licenses for reasons of limited space or public safety.
      9.   In the event that the City Manager designates a public way as a food
court under subsection H7 of this section, all public access to the food truck
must be on the side of the truck facing away from vehicle traffic, and if
present, along the sidewalk. The food truck cannot block access to a structure
for emergency response purposes and cannot interfere with traffic flow. The
City Manager reserves the right to specify exact locations on public ways and
in no event shall a State or Federal highway be used as a food truck court. The
City Manager reserves the right to limit the times and dates upon which food
truck courts may be designated in public ways. (Ord. 2107, 2017: Ord. 2104,
2017: Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.36.040: EXEMPTION:
A license is not required of:
   A.   Ordinary commercial travelers who sell or exhibit for sale goods or
merchandise to parties engaged in the business of buying and selling and
dealing in goods or merchandise or service, or to sales at wholesale and not
retail, or to sales of advertising in any phone book or other professional
directories;
   B.   Vendors of farm produce or agricultural products in their natural
state;
   C.   Sales of goods or merchandise donated by the owners thereof, the
proceeds whereof are to be applied to any charitable purpose; and
   D.   Agents of Okmulgee schools, churches or other nonprofit organizations.
(Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.36.050: REGISTRATION AND LICENSE FEES:
The license fee for each individual itinerant vendor shall be as follows:
 
1 day   $50.00
1 week  $100.00
1 month $200.00
1 year  $500.00
 
A registration fee, per Food Truck, shall be an annual cost of twenty dollars
($20.00). The license fee for each FOOD TRUCK vendor shall be twenty dollars
($20.00) per license for two (2) days in a calendar week. An annual license fee
may be purchased at the cost of five hundred dollars ($500.00), per year, in
which the two (2) days in a calendar week rule still applies. (Ord. 2192 § 1,
2023: Ord. 2107, 2017: Ord. 2104, 2017: Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.36.060: TRANSFER:
The license provided for herein shall not be transferable and does not give
authority to more than one person to conduct a business as an itinerant vendor.
(Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.36.070: GOING UPON PRIVATE RESIDENCES:
   A.   In the exercise of the authority conferred upon the City by State law,
the practice of going to, in or upon the premises of any private residence in
the City by any itinerant vendor without the express consent, request or
invitation of the owner or the occupant of such private residence, for the
purpose of soliciting orders for the purchase or for the sale of goods, wares,
or publications or merchandise of any description, or the purpose of peddling
or hawking the same, or for the purpose of soliciting subscriptions thereto, is
hereby prohibited.
   B.   This section shall not apply to salespersons, solicitors, peddlers or
order takers representing sales for recognized local nonprofit or charitable
organizations. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
5.36.080: PENALTY:
Any person, firm or corporation who engages in business without a license as
required by this chapter or violates any of the provisions of this chapter
shall be guilty of an offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined as provided
in section
1.12.010 of this Code. Violation of this chapter shall also be grounds for
revocation or suspension of any license granted. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2009)
CHAPTER 5.38
COMMERCIAL BUILDING MOVERS
SECTION:
5.38.010: License Required For Business
5.38.020: License Issuance Conditions; Bond Exceptions
5.38.030: Owner of Building Exempt From License Provisions
5.38.040: Permit; Required; Application And Contents
5.38.050: Permit; Approval; Fees
5.38.060: Permit; Approval; Conditions
5.38.070: Bond; Required
5.38.080: Warning Signs Or Lights Required
5.38.090: Interference With Utilities; Action
5.38.100: Compliance With State Statutes
5.38.010: LICENSE REQUIRED FOR BUSINESS:
No person, firm or corporation shall engage in the business of moving buildings
or structures within the corporate limits of the city before obtaining a
license to engage in such business. Any person, firm, or corporation holding
himself or itself out to the public as available to the public for the purpose
of moving buildings, or receiving or accepting pay for moving buildings or
making charges for such services, use of moving equipment and facilities, shall
for the purpose of this chapter, be engaged in the building moving business.
(Ord. 1931 § 2, 2008)
5.38.020: LICENSE ISSUANCE CONDITIONS; BOND EXCEPTIONS:
The community development department shall issue a building mover's license to
any person, firm or corporation when, but only when, the following conditions
have been met:
   A.   An annual license fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) has been paid. The
license shall expire on June 30 next succeeding the date of its issuance. The
community development department shall receipt all persons, firms or
corporations for said payment when made and accepted by the city under the
provisions of this chapter, and issue to the person, firm or corporation a
building mover's license.
   B.   The city building inspector shall inspect the equipment to be used (by
each applicant for such a license) in the business and the community
development department shall not issue the license unless the city building
inspector has, in writing, approved the equipment and facilities of the
applicant. Each letter or memorandum of inspection made by the city building
inspector directed to the community development department shall be concurred
in and approved by the chief of police of the city before it is accepted by the
community development department.
   C.   Before any such license may be issued, the licensee must submit a
surety bond running to the city in the amount of four thousand dollars
($4,000.00) to be approved by the city manager and conditioned that licensee
will save the city harmless from any loss or damage directly or indirectly
resulting from, and arising out of, the activity and operations of licensee.
(Ord. 1931 § 2, 2008)
5.38.030: OWNER OF BUILDING EXEMPT FROM LICENSE PROVISIONS:
The owner of a building may move his own building upon compliance with the
provisions of subsection
5.38.020C through section
5.38.100 of this chapter, and this notwithstanding the provisions of section
5.38.010 and subsections
5.38.020A and B of this chapter. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2008)
5.38.040: PERMIT; REQUIRED; APPLICATION AND CONTENTS:
No person, firm or corporation shall move any building on, across, through or
over any street, alley, sidewalk or other public place in the city without
obtaining a permit to do so from the community development department.
Application for such permits shall be made in writing to the city building
inspector and shall state thereon the proposed route over which the building is
to be moved and the scheduled number of days it is intended that the building
shall occupy any portion of any street, alley, sidewalk or other public place.
(Ord. 1931 § 2, 2008)
5.38.050: PERMIT; APPROVAL; FEES:
   A.   Upon approval of the application by the city building inspector, the
application shall be transmitted by the building inspector to the city clerk.
The city clerk shall issue a permit to the applicant on the payment of permit
fee as required in the following subsections:
      1.   A permit fee of twenty five dollars ($25.00) to move a building from
outside the city limits to a location within the city limits is hereby
established for the first day and each additional day or part thereof that it
is intended that the building shall occupy any portion of any public place.
      2.   A permit fee of fifteen dollars ($15.00) to move a building from one
location within the city to another location within the city is hereby
established for the first day and each additional day or part thereof that it
is intended that the building shall occupy any portion of any public place.
      3.   A permit fee of fifteen dollars ($15.00) to move a building from a
location inside the city limits to a point beyond the city limits is hereby
established for the first day and each additional day or part thereof that it
is intended that the building shall occupy any portion of any public place.
   B.   An additional fee of ten dollars ($10.00) is hereby established for
each additional day or part thereof over and above the time stated on the
application during which any building occupies any public place and shall be
paid upon completion of the moving. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2008)
5.38.060: PERMIT; APPROVAL; CONDITIONS:
   A.   The city building inspector shall not approve any application to move a
building except and until the applicant submits the following evidence to the
building inspector:
      1.   The applicant has made the required arrangements with all public
utilities whose properties or facilities are, or might be, affected by the
moving of such building;
      2.   This is to include railway companies in the event the route
designated in the application crosses railroad tracks or rights of way; and
      3.   The applicant has made the required arrangements with any necessary
plumbers, electrical contractors, or similar building professionals to install
such plumbing, electrical, or mechanical systems as may be legally necessary to
adapt the building to its intended use at the new location.
   B.   The city building inspector, before approving any application, shall
satisfy himself that the applicant has obtained proper clearance with the city
police department and the city fire department. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2008)
5.38.070: BOND; REQUIRED:
Every person, firm or corporation applying for a permit under this chapter
shall submit, concurrently with the submission of this application to the city
building inspector, a bond with good and sufficient corporate surety to be
approved by the city manager. The bond to be conditioned upon applicant's
compliance with all the provision of all applicable city ordinances and
agreeing to save the city harmless from any claim demand or suit which may be
made against it by reason of the suit and occupation of any street, alley,
sidewalk or other public place by such building or structure, and further
conditioned that the city shall be compensated for any damage or loss sustained
to its property, city streets, water mains or otherwise as a result of the
moving of such building upon and over the public properties, streets, alleys
and sidewalks of the city. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2008)
5.38.080: WARNING SIGNS OR LIGHTS REQUIRED:
Whenever a street or alley is blocked by a building or structure that is being
moved, warning to that effect shall be placed in such manner as the police
department may direct so as to warn vehicles and persons from entering that
portion of the street or other public place so blocked or obstructed. Warning
signs or lights and proper blockades shall be maintained by the person, firm or
corporation moving such building in such a manner as to guard against any
person or vehicle from colliding therewith. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2008)
5.38.090: INTERFERENCE WITH UTILITIES; ACTION:
In the event it becomes necessary in connection with the moving of such
building to interfere with the wires, cables, pipes, tiles or tracks of any
public utility, including city water and sewer lines, the terms of any special
or franchise ordinance governing shall apply and if required thereby such
special bond given as may be specified. If the estimated cost of cutting wires
and the replacement thereof or other utility facilities are not fixed by
franchise or ordinance, the amount thereof shall be agreed upon by the utility
and the person, firm, or corporation desiring the permit. If the utility and
the applicant for the permit are unable to agree, the city building inspector
shall designate the amount. A deposit of the estimated amount shall be made
with the utility. The utility, upon receiving the deposit, shall issue its
receipt for the amount thereof to the applicant and transmit a duplicate copy
of the receipt to the city clerk. Actual interference with public or private
utilities shall be allowed in the absence of such agreements and notice to the
utilities in writing of the days and times and locations of such interference.
(Ord. 1931 § 2, 2008)
5.38.100: COMPLIANCE WITH STATE STATUTES:
No building or structure shall be moved by either the owner or a licensed
building mover in the city unless it can be moved without violating the
statutes of the state with respect to the size, weights and loads, as provided
for in 47 Oklahoma Statutes section 14-101 et seq., and which sections are by
reference made a part of this chapter. (Ord. 1931 § 2, 2008)
CHAPTER 5.42
JUNK DEALERS AND SALVAGE DEALERS
SECTION:
5.42.010: Purpose And Interpretation
5.42.020: Definitions
5.42.030: Sales Tax Permits
5.42.040: Records
5.42.050: Transaction Book Or Register
5.42.060: Holding
5.42.070: Proof Of Ownership Required For Purchase Of Certain Property;
Penalties
5.42.080: Payment Methods For Amounts In Excess Of Twenty Five Dollars
5.42.090: Violations And Penalties
5.42.010: PURPOSE AND INTERPRETATION:
It is the intent of this chapter to provide for the enforcement of applicable
state law on the local level. However, it is not the intent to impose new
substantive requirements on business that do not presently exist under state
law. However, there will be additional reporting requirements and additional
enforcement hereunder. Therefore, all interpretations of 59 Oklahoma Statutes
section 1421 et seq., shall be considered to be incorporated by reference
herein. (Ord. 1920 § 1, 2008)
5.42.020: DEFINITIONS:
As used in herein, the following terms shall have the meanings indicated:
ALUMINUM MATERIAL: The metal aluminum or aluminum alloy or anything made of
either aluminum or aluminum alloy, except aluminum cans.
COPPER MATERIAL: The metal copper or copper alloy or anything made of either
copper or copper alloy.
JUNK DEALER OR SALVAGE DEALER: Any person, firm or corporation being an owner,
keeper or proprietor of a junk shop, junk store, salvage yard or scrap
processor handling copper or aluminum material; a collector or dealer in junk,
salvage or other property made of copper material or aluminum metal; anyone
purchasing or handling copper material or aluminum material for remelting
purposes; or anyone purchasing, handling or transferring vehicles for purposes
of crushing, baling, shredding, flattening, recycling and reselling as bulk or
processed metal.
YARD: The place where any junk dealer or salvage dealer stores copper material
or aluminum material or keeps the same for purpose of sale. (Ord. 1920 § 1,
2008)
5.42.030: SALES TAX PERMITS:
   A.   Any junk dealer or salvage dealer and any person, firm, corporation or
other legal entity desiring to become a junk dealer or salvage dealer shall
prior to the commencement of business file a verified application and obtain a
sales tax permit, as provided by 68 Oklahoma Statutes section 1364, from the
Oklahoma tax commission. Each junk dealer or salvage dealer shall maintain at
least one yard and, if such junk dealer or salvage dealer maintains or desires
to maintain more than one yard, the junk dealer or salvage dealer shall obtain,
in addition to the original sales tax permit, a duplicate sales tax permit for
each additional yard.
   B.   The junk dealer or salvage dealer shall prominently display said
Oklahoma tax commission sales tax permits and shall otherwise make it available
to the public upon request. (Ord. 1920 § 1, 2008)
5.42.040: RECORDS:
   A.   Every junk dealer or salvage dealer shall keep a separate book or
register in which he shall enter the following information: name, address, age,
driver's license number, or, if driver's license is not available, similar
definite identification of the person or persons from whom thirty five (35)
pounds or more of copper or copper alloy utilized by persons, firms,
corporations or municipal corporations engaged in the transmission and
distribution of electric energy, or engaged in telephone, telegraph or other
communications is purchased; license tag number of vehicle or conveyance in
which delivered; the date and place of each purchase of such copper or copper
alloy; the description should include the weight of said copper or copper alloy
purchased, including whether the same is in wire, cable, bars, rods, or tubing
and if any installation is thereon the names and addresses of the persons,
groups of persons or corporations from whom seller purchased said copper or
copper alloy. Such book or register shall be made available to any law
enforcement official or the representatives of persons, firms, corporations or
municipal corporations described above for inspection at any time.
   B.   A junk dealer or salvage dealer who purchases copper material shall
also report, in writing, all purchases of thirty five (35) pounds or more of
copper material not exempt from the ten (10) day holding period to the sheriff
of the county in which said purchases are made, and to the chief of police of
the city; provided that an accurate copy of the report made to the sheriff
shall be considered compliance as to the city. The report shall be made in
writing to said sheriff and said chief of police within forty eight (48) hours
after any such purchase is made and shall contain all of the information
required to be maintained in the book or register provided for herein.
   C.   Every junk dealer or salvage dealer shall keep a separate book or
register in which the dealer shall enter the following information: name,
address, age, driver's license number, or, if driver's license is not
available, similar definite identification of the person or persons from whom
thirty five (35) pounds or more of aluminum is purchased; license tag number of
vehicle or conveyance in which delivered; the date and place of each purchase
of such aluminum; a description including the weight of the aluminum purchased,
the names and addresses of the persons, groups of persons or corporations from
whom seller purchased said aluminum. The book or register shall be made
available to any law enforcement official for inspection at any time.
   D.   A junk dealer or salvage dealer who purchases aluminum shall also
report, in writing, all purchases of thirty five (35) pounds or more of
aluminum to the sheriff of the county in which the purchases are made, and to
the chief of police of the city; provided that an accurate copy of the report
made to the sheriff shall be considered compliance as to the city. The report
shall be made in writing to said sheriff and said chief of police within forty
eight (48) hours after said request is made and shall contain all of the
information required to be maintained in the book or register provided for in
this section.
   E.   The provisions of this section shall not apply to the sale or purchase
of aluminum beverage cans which are obtained for recycling purposes. (Ord. 1920
§ 1, 2008)
5.42.050: TRANSACTION BOOK OR REGISTER:
   A.   Every junk dealer or salvage dealer shall keep a separate book or
register in which the junk dealer or salvage dealer shall enter the following
information: name, address, age, driver's license number, or, if driver's
license is not available, similar definite identification, as approved by rule
of the Oklahoma tax commission, of the person or persons from whom a vehicle is
purchased; license tag number of vehicle or conveyance in which delivered; the
date and place of each purchase of a vehicle; and a description of the vehicle
purchased including make, model, vehicle identification number and license tag
number. The person selling the vehicle shall be required to present to the junk
dealer or salvage dealer the title of the vehicle verifying ownership of the
vehicle or a verified bill of sale from the owner of the vehicle or other proof
of ownership. Such book or register shall be made available to any law
enforcement official for inspection at any time.
   B.   Any purchases, transfers or handling between junk dealer or salvage
dealers with permits and/or licensed automotive dismantlers and parts recyclers
shall be exempt from the provisions of this section. (Ord. 1920 § 1, 2008)
5.42.060: HOLDING:
Each purchase of thirty five (35) pounds or more of copper or copper alloy
utilized by persons, firms, corporations or municipal corporations engaged in
the transmission and distribution of electric energy, or engaged in telephone,
telegraph or other communications shall be held separate and apart so that such
copper and copper alloy shall be readily identifiable from all other purchases
for a period of not less than ten (10) days from the date of purchase of such
copper or copper alloy, during which period the purchaser shall not change the
form of said copper or copper alloy and shall permit any law enforcement
officer or the representatives of persons, firms, corporations or municipal
corporations to make inspection of such copper material during said ten (10)
day holding period; provided, however, that all such purchases made from
persons, firms, corporations or municipal corporations who construct, operate,
maintain or sell electric distribution and transmission communications
facilities, or produce scrap copper material in the normal course of business
or the sale of copper material by one licensed junk dealer or salvage dealer to
another are not subject to said ten (10) day holding period; but there shall be
required from such persons, firms, corporations or municipal corporations a
bill of sale or other written evidence of title of such purchases. (Ord. 1920 §
1, 2008)
5.42.070: PROOF OF OWNERSHIP REQUIRED FOR PURCHASE OF CERTAIN PROPERTY;
PENALTIES:
   A.   A junk dealer or salvage dealer or salvage dealer licensed or permitted
to do business in this state shall not purchase any of the following items
without obtaining proof that the seller owns the property, either by receipt,
bill of sale or other proof of ownership, or proof that the seller is an
employee, agent, or contractor of a governmental entity, utility company,
cemetery, railroad, manufacturer, or other person, business or entity owning
the property and the seller is authorized to sell the item on behalf of the
person, business or entity owning the property:
      1.   A manhole cover;
      2.   An electric light pole and its fixtures and hardware or any other
hardware associated with the electric utility system;
      3.   A guardrail;
      4.   A street sign, traffic sign or traffic signal and its fixtures or
hardware;
      5.   Communications, transmission and service wire;
      6.   A funeral marker or funeral vase;
      7.   A historical marker;
      8.   Railroad equipment, including, but not limited to, a tie plate,
switch plate, E clip or rail tie junction;
      9.   Any metal item that is marked with any form of the name, initials or
logo of a governmental entity, utility company, cemetery or railroad;
      10.   A copper or aluminum condensing or evaporating coil from a heating
or air conditioning unit;
      11.   An aluminum or stainless steel container or bottle designed to hold
propane for fueling forklifts;
      12.   Metal bleachers or other seating facilities used in recreational
areas or sporting arenas;
      13.   Automotive catalytic converters;
      14.   Plumbing or electrical fixtures;
      15.   Tools;
      16.   Machinery or supplies commonly used in the drilling, completing,
operating or repairing of oil or gas wells; and
      17.   Metal beer kegs that are clearly marked as being the property of
the beer manufacturer. (Ord. 1920 § 1, 2008)
5.42.080: PAYMENT METHODS FOR AMOUNTS IN EXCESS OF TWENTY FIVE DOLLARS:
Any junk dealer or salvage dealer or salvage dealer licensed or permitted to do
business in this state shall be required to pay the seller of any material,
regulated by the provisions of 59 Oklahoma Statutes section 1421 et seq., or
this act, with a check, bank draft, money order, electronic transfer of funds
or any other legal means other than cash for any amount in excess of twenty
five dollars ($25.00) per transaction. Such payment may be provided at the time
of purchase or by mail, as determined by the junk dealer or salvage dealer. If
payment is to be made by mail, the junk dealer or salvage dealer shall provide
the seller with a sales receipt at the time such items are accepted. (Ord. 1920
§ 1, 2008)
5.42.090: VIOLATIONS AND PENALTIES:
   A.   No person shall act as a junk dealer or salvage dealer without a
permit, as required by state statute; provided that each day of operation
without a license constitutes a separate offense.
   B.   No junk dealer or salvage dealer shall fail to maintain records, as
required by state statute and this chapter. Each separate purchase or transfer
of a vehicle in violation of this chapter shall be considered a separate
violation of this chapter.
   C.   No junk dealer or salvage dealer shall fail to hold copper, copper
alloy, aluminum, aluminum alloy and any materials listed in section
5.42.060 of this chapter, for ten (10) days as required by law.
   D.   No person shall knowingly give false information with respect to the
information required in this chapter.
   E.   Each conviction of a junk dealer or salvage dealer for violation of any
provision of this act shall be reported to the Oklahoma tax commission by the
clerk of the court, in addition to such penalties as may be available under
general provisions for violation of city ordinances. (Ord. 1920 § 1, 2008)
CHAPTER 5.46
COMMERCIAL/INDUSTRIAL CERTIFICATE OF OCCUPANCY
SECTION:
5.46.010: Certificate of Occupancy
5.46.010: CERTIFICATE OF OCCUPANCY:
No building or structure shall be commercially/Industrially used or occupied,
and no change in the existing occupancy classification of a building or
structure or portion thereof shall be made until the building official has
issued a certificate of occupancy therefore as provided herein. Occupying a
structure is defined as any person or object not participating in the
construction process maintaining a presence on the property for a period of
more than eight hours per day. Issuance of a certificate of occupancy shall not
be construed as an approval of a violation of the provisions of this code or of
other ordinances of the City of Okmulgee. Certificates presuming to give
authority to violate or cancel the provisions of this code or other ordinances
of the City of Okmulgee shall not be valid. The fee to obtain a Certificate of
Occupancy shall be $100.00. (Ord. 2174 § 1, 2022)
CHAPTER 5.50
CERTIFICATE OF COMPLIANCE FOR OMMA BUSINESSES
SECTION:
5.50.010: Certificate Of Compliance (OMMA); Fee; Inspection; Issuance:
5.50.010: CERTIFICATE OF COMPLIANCE (OMMA); FEE; INSPECTION; ISSUANCE:
   A.   Every applicant for a new/renewal OMMA certificate of compliance with
the Zoning, Fire, Health and Safety Codes of the City required by Title 63 of
Oklahoma Statutes and regulations imposed by OMMA or its successor entity,
shall apply at the Office of the City Clerk by:
      1.   Providing an OMMA Certificate of Compliance form supplied by the
Oklahoma Medical Marijuana Authority (OMMA); and
      2.   Paying to the City Clerk an inspection fee in the amount of two
hundred dollars ($200.00) for new applicants and one hundred dollars ($100.00)
for annual renewal applicants, after all inspections have been passed and
approved.
   B.   Upon receipt of a certificate of compliance inspection, the City Clerk
shall cause an investigation to be made to determine whether the premises
proposed for licensed operations comply with the provisions of the zoning
ordinances and any Health, Fire, Building and other Safety Codes or regulations
applicable to it.
   C.   Upon finding that the premises of an applicant for a certificate is in
compliance with all applicable Zoning, Fire, Health and Safety Codes and
ordinances and regulations, a certificate of compliance shall be issued. (Ord.
2175 § 1, 2022)
TITLE 6
ANIMALS
General Provisions   6.04
Animals Within City; Regulations   6.08
Licensing, Vaccinations, And Tags   6.12
Animal Shelter And Impoundment   6.20
Contract Licensing   6.24
CHAPTER 6.04
GENERAL PROVISIONS
SECTION:
6.04.010: Definitions
6.04.020: Powers And Duties Of Animal Control Officer
6.04.030: Animals That Disturb Prohibited
6.04.040: Diseased Animals And Sale Of Diseased Animals
6.04.050: Sale Or Donation Of Animals
6.04.010: DEFINITIONS:
The following words and phrases, when used in this title, shall have the
meanings ascribed in this section, except in those cases where the context
clearly indicates a different meaning:
ANIMAL: Any horse, mule, donkey, pony, cow, sheep, goat, hog, pig, dog, cat,
rabbit, chicken, goose, duck, turkey, or other animal or fowl; but this term
shall not be interpreted to include humans.
AT HEEL: Within a radius of ten feet (10') of the owner and obedient to the
owner's commands.
AT LARGE: That an animal is:
   A.   Off the premises of its owner while not securely and physically
restrained by means of a chain, harness, leash, rope or other device required
to restrain such animal. Such restraint must be anchored or otherwise held by a
person capable of controlling the animal. Provided, that an anchored animal
shall not be allowed onto the private property of someone other than the owner.
   B.   On the unenclosed portions of the premises of the owner, but not
confined or at heel and on a leash held by a person capable of controlling the
animal.
DANGEROUS ANIMAL: Any animal that:
   A.   Has bitten, attempted to bite, or attacked any person without
provocation; or
   B.   Has bitten or attempted to bite, or attacked other animals it may meet
without provocation; or
   C.   Because of temperament, conditioning, or training, has a known
propensity to attack, bite, or injure human beings or domesticated animals.
Provided, that this definition shall not include dogs owned by any unit of
government, which are trained and used as a part of a law enforcement team,
based on any conduct associated with their training, practice, or law
enforcement activities; nor shall this definition be based on the animal's
conduct when the person injured was at the time committing a wilful trespass,
other tort, or a crime upon the premises occupied by the owner of the dog, or
when the person injured was tormenting, abusing or assaulting the dog.
NUISANCE ANIMAL: Any animal which:
   A.   Digs into the landscaping, garden or similar property of any person
other than its owner; or
   B.   Scatters garbage or other waste; or
   C.   Chases any domestic animals; or
   D.   Chases vehicles; or
   E.   Chases or threatens people at locations where the people are entitled
to be; or
   F.   Through the creation of offensive odor, lack of sanitation or the
creation of excessive and repeated noise, becomes a significant disturbance to
the peace and welfare of the inhabitants of the community; or
   G.   Has been found at large on three (3) occasions within a twelve (12)
month period.
OWNER: Any person:
   A.   Possessing legal title to any animal, or
   B.   Possessing no legal title, keeps or harbors the animal for more than
ten (10) days.
WILD OR EXOTIC ANIMAL: An animal which would ordinarily be confined to a zoo,
or one which would ordinarily be found in the wilderness of this or any other
country, or one which otherwise causes a reasonable person to be fearful of
bodily harm or significant destruction of property. Such animals are further
defined as being any snake, and those mammals or those nonvenomous reptiles
weighing over fifty (50) pounds at maturity, which are known at law as "ferae
naturae". Wild or exotic animals specifically include first and second
generation hybrids between "ferae naturae" and domestic animals. Wild or exotic
animals specifically do not include animals of a species customarily used in
Oklahoma as ordinary household pets, animals of a species customarily used in
Oklahoma as domestic farm animals, fish confined in an aquarium, birds or
invertebrates. (Ord. 1877 § 2, 2006)
6.04.020: POWERS AND DUTIES OF ANIMAL CONTROL OFFICER:
   A.   The Okmulgee police department or such other department as designated
by the city manager shall be responsible for the enforcement of all provisions
of this title. The officers or other designated department employees are
authorized to pick up animals in violation of the provisions of this title,
impound them in the shelter, and/or cite the owners.
   B.   The chief of the Okmulgee police department or such other person as
designated by the city manager shall assign a designated representative(s) to
impound all animals lawfully brought to the shelter. The designated employee(s)
shall provide suitable humane treatment for them. No impounded animal shall be
released to its owner until all impoundment fees, room and board charges, and
license fees are paid in full.
   C.   The animal control officer may inspect any structure or place where an
animal is kept upon complaint of any person or on individual initiative, if the
location is available to the public, or observable from a public area; if the
area is not observable then the officer may seek a warrant and conduct the
inspection under the terms thereof.
   D.   Following any inspection, the animal control officer may issue
reasonable orders as to corrective actions needed to restrain the animals or to
prevent cruelty to animals from occurring, or to take temporary custody of
animals in excess of the prescribed limits for the lot in question. (Ord. 2073,
2015: Ord. 1877 § 2, 2006)
6.04.030: ANIMALS THAT DISTURB PROHIBITED:
It is unlawful for any person to keep or harbor within the city any dog or
other animal which by habitual barking, howling, or otherwise, disturbs the
peace and quiet of any person. The keeping of such an animal is hereby declared
a public nuisance. (Ord. 1877 § 2, 2006)
6.04.040: DISEASED ANIMALS AND SALE OF DISEASED ANIMALS:
It shall be unlawful for any person to procure or knowingly distribute diseased
animals without complete disclosure for the purpose of transferring ownership,
whether such animal is sold or given away. (Ord. 1877 § 2, 2006)
6.04.050: SALE OR DONATION OF ANIMALS:
It is unlawful for any person, group, or organization other than the Okmulgee
animal shelter, the Okmulgee County Humane Society, a licensed veterinarian, or
a permitted commercial animal establishment as described in section
6.12.020 of this title to accept unwanted animals as a rescue agency or to
offer for sale or by free donation in a public or commercial location in the
city of Okmulgee dogs, cats, or other animals or to falsely represent
themselves as an agent of any of the above excepted entities. (Ord. 1877 § 2,
2006)
CHAPTER 6.08
ANIMALS WITHIN CITY; REGULATIONS
SECTION:
6.08.010: Animals Not To Be Kept Within City
6.08.020: Animals Confined In Primary Residence
6.08.030: Rabies Vaccination Required
6.08.040: Keeping Livestock Or Fowl Within City Prohibited; Exceptions
6.08.050: Restriction On Location Of Stables, Kennels, Coops, Etc.
6.08.060: General Maintenance Requirements For Places Where Animals Are Kept
6.08.070: Restraint Of Animals
6.08.080: Prohibited Conduct Relating To Animals
6.08.090: Number Of Animals Allowed In Residential Areas
6.08.100: Animal Waste
6.08.110: Animal Care
6.08.120: Cruelty To Animals
6.08.010: ANIMALS NOT TO BE KEPT WITHIN CITY:
   A.   It shall be unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to keep,
maintain, possess or have under their control within the city any venomous
reptile, any snake, or any wild or exotic animal.
   B.   The provisions of this section shall not apply to lawfully operated and
located pet shops, menageries, zoological gardens, scientific research
laboratories, circuses, nor veterinarians harboring such animals for purposes
of providing professional medical treatment, provided that the animals are
maintained in quarters so constructed and maintained as to prevent escape.
   C.   The provisions of this section shall not apply to existing reptiles or
wild or exotic animals which are kept, maintained or possessed within the city
on August 15, 2006, or which come under the jurisdiction of the city through
annexation, if the owner or keeper thereof gives written notice to the city
clerk within thirty (30) days of the time when the keeping of the animal comes
under the jurisdiction of the city. This notice shall include the existence,
genus and species, age and location of each animal, together with the
provisions for the confining thereof, and copies of all state and federal
permits that may be required. Annually, the owner of any exempt animal under
this subsection shall further provide the city a letter, certificate, or other
appropriate documentation from a qualified veterinarian, or by a fully
accredited member of the Association of Zoological Parks and Aquariums, or by
the Oklahoma wildlife commission, or by the department of natural resources
that the exempt animal is being kept in conditions which are adequate to any
specific biological requirements necessary for the animal's health and well
being, and in a habitat which is not cruel or abusive to the animal. The
confinement of animals described in this subsection must meet the regulations
promulgated by the Oklahoma wildlife commission and the minimum standards under
the animal welfare act and all applicable rules promulgated by the United
States department of agriculture. In addition to meeting the above minimum
standards, all such venomous reptiles and all such wild or exotic animals shall
be confined, restrained and controlled in such a manner so the physical safety
or property of any person lawfully entering the premises shall not be
endangered; this shall specifically require fully enclosed quarters for the
animal, so constructed as to prevent escape. In areas having a primary use
other than agriculture, the quarters must be double walled enclosures, adequate
to protect the animal from the harassment or provocation of individuals, and
must include both foundations and roofing materials adequate to prevent escape
by climbing or burrowing. The city shall annually inspect the enclosures to
determine whether the property complies with this section or contains a hazard
to safety; the owner shall pay an inspection fee in an amount set by resolution
of the city council. Provided, that said snakes, venomous reptiles or wild or
exotic animals shall not be replaced upon death, sale, transfer or loss of
possession for any reason including escape for any duration, and shall not be
allowed on any public street, sidewalk or other public way, except in a fully
enclosed cage or adequate structural restraint. The use of a leash, with or
without a muzzle, shall not be considered adequate restraint.
   D.   It is unlawful for any person being the owner of or having the care,
custody, or control thereof to keep or suffer to be kept any dangerous animal
within the city. Violation of this section shall result in assessment of a fine
in the amount approved by resolution of the city council and confiscation of
the dangerous animal by the animal control officer for immediate euthanasia.
(Ord. 1877 § 2, 2006)
6.08.020: ANIMALS CONFINED IN PRIMARY RESIDENCE:
Any tame rodent, nonexcluded captive bred reptile, amphibian or bird may be
kept within the city only if they are confined within the owner's primary
residence as pets. (Ord. 1877 § 2, 2006)
6.08.030: RABIES VACCINATION REQUIRED:
It shall be an offense for any person to keep, harbor or maintain any dog or
cat over six (6) months old within the city limits without having that animal
vaccinated annually against rabies. Provided, that the owner of a dog or cat
may have the dog or cat vaccinated against rabies by a licensed veterinarian on
a triannual basis, so long as the veterinarian certifies that the vaccination
was performed with a three (3) year vaccine and that the owner maintains the
vaccination in a current status. The licensed veterinarian who administers
either the one year or the three (3) year vaccination shall issue to the owner
of such animal a certificate stating the name of the owner, a description of
the animal, the type, duration and date of the vaccination; the veterinarian
shall also issue a metal tag with the veterinarian's office address and the
year of vaccination stamped thereon. The owner or keeper shall affix to the
collar or harness of each vaccinated dog or cat the metal tag provided at the
time of vaccination. The failure of an animal to wear a vaccination tag on its
collar or harness shall be prima facie evidence of the failure of the owner to
have the animal vaccinated. (Ord. 1877 § 2, 2006)
6.08.040: KEEPING LIVESTOCK OR FOWL WITHIN CITY PROHIBITED; EXCEPTIONS:
No horses, donkeys, mules, cattle, sheep, goats, swine, chickens, geese, ducks,
guineas, turkeys, or other livestock or fowl shall be kept within the city
except:
   A.   Temporarily (less than 72 hours) in a stockyard or slaughterhouse
awaiting transportation or processing; or
   B.   Excluding commercial zoning, said animals may be kept on a tract which
is fully conforming with all requirements for applicable zoning, and having at
least one acre for every horse, cow, or goat being kept on such property; or
   C.   As a part of the normal business operation of a licensed veterinarian
or an animal hospital.
Provided that this section shall not prevent the keeping of the offspring of
lawfully kept livestock for the first six (6) months following their birth.
(Ord. 1946 § 1, 2010)
6.08.050: RESTRICTION ON LOCATION OF STABLES, KENNELS, COOPS, ETC.:
It shall be an offense for any person to maintain any stable, kennel, or
similar establishment wherein animals are kept closer than one hundred feet
(100') from any tenement or apartment house, hotel, restaurant, boarding house,
retail food store, building used for educational or religious or hospital
purposes, or residence other than that occupied by the owner or occupant of the
premises upon which such animal is kept. Every building wherein any animal is
kept shall be constructed of such material and in such manner that it can be
kept clean and sanitary at all times. (Ord. 1877 § 2, 2006)
6.08.060: GENERAL MAINTENANCE REQUIREMENTS FOR PLACES WHERE ANIMALS ARE KEPT:
Every stable, kennel, pen, or other place wherein an animal is kept or
permitted to be shall be maintained in a clean and sanitary condition, devoid
of rodents and vermin and free from objectionable odors. The owner of every
animal shall be responsible for the removal of any excreta deposited by the
owner's animal(s) on public walks, streets, alleys, parks, recreational areas,
other public areas, or on the private property of another. (Ord. 1877 § 2,
2006)
6.08.070: RESTRAINT OF ANIMALS:
All animals kept within the city limits of Okmulgee shall be kept under
restraint with proper care and control of said animals to prevent them from
becoming a public nuisance. Restraint for various animals shall comply with the
following requirements:
   A.   All dogs must be confined in a fenced area, chained so that they are
confined within the boundaries of the owner's property, or be restrained by a
leash held by a person at least twelve (12) years of age and of sufficient
weight and strength to control the animal.
   B.   Every female dog or cat in heat shall be confined in a building or
secure enclosure in such a manner that such female dog or cat cannot come into
contact with another animal except for planned breeding. (Ord. 1877 § 2, 2006)
6.08.080: PROHIBITED CONDUCT RELATING TO ANIMALS:
   A.   It shall be unlawful for any owner to fail to prevent any animal owned,
harbored or kept by him from being at large within the city.
   B.   It shall be unlawful for any person to abandon or desert any domestic
animal or permit any such animal to become a stray, provided, however, nothing
in this paragraph shall prevent the trap, neuter and release of animals that
appear to already be abandoned or stray animals in an effort to control the
unneutered stray animal population. Any animal subject to a trap, neuter and
release shall be vaccinated for rabies and cleared of serious or fatal
communicable disease (such as rabies, feline leukemia or parvo) and neutered by
a veterinarian or other professional approved through the State of Oklahoma,
before being released to the local area where the animal was found.
   C.   It shall be unlawful for any person to open any enclosure in which an
animal is confined so as to turn such animal at large, or in any other manner
to release such animal to roam at large.
