CHAPTER 9.04
INTERFERENCE WITH PUBLIC AUTHORITY
SECTION:
9.04.010: Refusing Or Failing To Assist An Officer
9.04.020: Resisting Or Obstructing Officers
9.04.030: Rescuing Or Assisting Prisoners To Escape
9.04.040: Prisoner Escape
9.04.050: Impersonating An Officer Or City Employee
9.04.060: False Fire Alarm
9.04.070: False Representation Or Perjury
9.04.080: Removal Of Barricade Or Obstruction Authorized By City
9.04.100: Failure To Obey Order To Limit Or Cease Water Usage During Emergency
9.04.110: Unauthorized Access To City Communications System
9.04.010: REFUSING OR FAILING TO ASSIST AN OFFICER:
   A.   An officer of the city making or about to make an arrest, or executing
or about to execute a warrant or other process, in accordance with the
ordinances of the city or with state or federal law, or suppressing or about to
suppress a riot, affray or unlawful assembly, may call upon a person or persons
to assist him in making such arrest, executing such process or suppressing such
riot, affray or unlawful assembly.
   B.   It is unlawful for any person lawfully called upon thus to assist an
officer of the city to refuse or fail to do so. (Prior code § 421)
9.04.020: RESISTING OR OBSTRUCTING OFFICERS:
It is unlawful for any person knowingly or wilfully to resist, oppose or
obstruct the chief of police, any other policeman, the municipal judge, or any
other officer or employee of the city in the discharge of his official duties;
or, by threats or otherwise, to intimidate or attempt to intimidate any such
officer or employee from the discharge of his official duties; or to assault,
beat, revile, abuse, be disrespectful to, or use abusive or indecent language
toward or about, any such officer or employee while such officer or employee is
in the discharge of his official duties. (Prior code § 422)
9.04.030: RESCUING OR ASSISTING PRISONERS TO ESCAPE:
It is unlawful for any person in any illegal manner to set at liberty, rescue
or attempt to set at liberty or rescue, any prisoner or prisoners, from any
officer or employee of the city having legal custody of the same or from the
city jail or other place of confinement by the city, or to assist such prisoner
in any manner to escape from such prison or custody. (Prior code § 423)
9.04.040: PRISONER ESCAPE:
It is unlawful for any person confined in the city jail or other place of
confinement by the city, or working upon the streets or other public places of
the city in pursuance of any judgment, or otherwise held in legal custody by
authority of the city, to escape or attempt to escape from any such jail,
prison or custody. (Prior code § 424)
9.04.050: IMPERSONATING AN OFFICER OR CITY EMPLOYEE:
It is unlawful for any person to personate any officer or employee of the city,
falsely represent himself to be an officer or employee of the city, or exercise
or attempt to exercise any of the duties, functions or powers of an officer or
employee of the city without being duly authorized to do so. (Prior code § 425)
9.04.060: FALSE FIRE ALARM:
It is unlawful for any person to turn in a false fire alarm, or in any manner
to deceive or attempt to deceive the fire department or any officer or employee
thereof with reference to any fire alarm or reported fire, or knowingly to
cause the fire department or its officers or employees to make a useless run.
(Prior code § 426)
9.04.070: FALSE REPRESENTATION OR PERJURY:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation, or any agent or employee
thereof, knowingly to make any material misrepresentation to any officer,
employee or agency of the city government in any official application to, or
official dealing or negotiation with, such officer or agency; or to commit
perjury before any tribunal or officer of the city. (Prior code § 427)
9.04.080: REMOVAL OF BARRICADE OR OBSTRUCTION AUTHORIZED BY CITY:
It is unlawful for any person except by proper authority to remove any
barricade or obstruction placed by authority of the city to keep traffic off
any pavement, street, curb, sidewalk or other area. (Prior code § 428)
9.04.100: FAILURE TO OBEY ORDER TO LIMIT OR CEASE WATER USAGE DURING EMERGENCY:
   A.   It is unlawful and an offense for any person, firm or corporation to
use or continue to use water from the city's water system at such times and in
such manner as are determined by the city manager or his/her designee to be
limited and/or prohibited for purposes of water conservation during a water
emergency declared by the city manager or his/her designee, to be necessary to
protect the city and public, which emergency declaration shall be announced to
the public, including all relevant details and limitations, through notice in a
newspaper of general circulation throughout the city and/or notice on radio
stations and/or television stations, including, but not limited to, cable
television and/or notice provided in person by an employee of the city and/or
any other notice in a form reasonably calculated to inform the public of the
declared water emergency situation.
   B.   The city council reserves the right at all times to review any and all
declarations of water emergency and to affirm, set aside and/or modify any and
all such declarations for which public notice shall be provided in a form(s) as
above provided. It is also unlawful and an offense for any person, firm or
corporation to use or continue to use water from the city's water system at
such times and in such manner as are determined by the council of the city to
be prohibited during an emergency declared by the city manager and affirmed or
modified by the council of the city.
   C.   Any person, firm or corporation which violates this section of the code
commits an offense and shall, upon conviction, be fined in an amount of not to
exceed one hundred dollars ($100.00) plus court costs, per each offense, and
each day an offense continues shall be deemed a separate offense and punishable
as such. (Ord. 1781 § 1, 2001)
9.04.110: UNAUTHORIZED ACCESS TO CITY COMMUNICATIONS SYSTEM:
   A.   For purposes of this section:
      ACCESS: Shall include, but not be limited to: 1) any physical access to
the communication computer hardware, server hardware, antenna array, repeaters,
or wiring, and 2) any electronic access to or monitoring of city owned or
operated frequencies or software, and 3) any attempt through any means to
modify the communications software, and 4) any programming or use of radio
equipment or scanners in such a way as to emulate city equipment. Access shall
not include the use of the telephone handsets and keypads as simple
communication devices between/to persons using other handsets; access shall not
include the use of city owned emergency personnel radios as simple
communication devices with the city's dispatch or with other emergency
personnel radios.
      ATTEMPT TO ACCESS: Shall include, but not be limited to: 1) any attempt
to physically access city communication equipment, and 2) any attempt to
electronically access city owned or operated frequencies or software, and 3)
any attempt to persuade city employees to release programming information
without authorization.
   B.   It is unlawful for any person, agency, firm, group or entity to access
or attempt to access any component of the communication system owned or
operated by the city of Okmulgee, for any reason without prior written
authorization. Provided that in times of emergency, the city manager, may grant
access for a limited time to the city owned or operated communication system by
verbal order. If the city manager is absent or unavailable during such an
emergency, then the police chief, fire chief, or emergency management director
may give such limited access by verbal order.
   C.   It is unlawful to direct any radio or other electronic signal at any
city owned building, antenna array, repeater, or comparable device in such a
way: 1) as to block the city's ability to use such item as a part of its
communications with its own public safety personnel or with public safety
personnel who are working with the city or for any other governmental or tribal
agency, or 2) as to use up a portion of the bandwidth assigned to the city of
Okmulgee or its trusts, so that the bandwidth is less available to the city's
public safety personnel.
   D.   Each day of interference or each day of unauthorized access shall be
considered a separate offense. Each physical address at which such interference
or unauthorized access occurs shall be considered a separate offense.
   E.   Any person convicted of any violation of this section shall be punished
not less than the highest minimum and more than the highest maximum penalty
allowed by this code. (Ord. 1958, 2010)
CHAPTER 9.12
ASSAULT AND BATTERY
SECTION:
9.12.010: Assault and Battery and Domestic Assault and Battery Defined and
Prohibited
9.12.010: ASSAULT AND BATTERY AND DOMESTIC ASSAULT AND BATTERY DEFINED AND
PROHIBITED:
   A.   Definitions:
 
                              Any willful and unlawful attempt or offer with
ASSAULT:                      force or violence to do a corporal hurt to
                              another.
BATTERY:                      Any willful and unlawful use of force or violence
                              upon the person of another.
                              Any assault and/or battery upon the person of
DOMESTIC ASSAULT AND BATTERY: another who is an intimate partner, engaged in a
                              dating relationship, former intimate partner, or
                              family member or co-habitant.
 
   B.   Prohibited:
It is unlawful for any person to commit an assault or an assault and battery
within the city. Any person committing an assault or assault and battery within
the city is guilty of a misdemeanor.
It is unlawful for any person to commit a domestic assault or a domestic
assault and battery within the city and anyone committing a domestic assault or
a domestic assault and battery within the city is guilty of a misdemeanor.
A physical arrest may be made for a domestic assault and battery committed
within the city, but outside the presence of the officer, if the officer
witnesses injuries resulting from the assault and battery and the officer has
probable cause to believe the assault and battery occurred within the preceding
72 hours. (Ord. 2164 § 1, 2022: Prior code § 411)
CHAPTER 9.20
ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES 1
SECTION:
9.20.010: Definitions

9.20.230: Intoxicated Persons Not Allowed To Remain In Clubs, Restaurants Or

9.20.010: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this chapter:
RETAIL ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE STORE: A package store.
WHOLESALE ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE STORE: A store operated under the authority of a
state wholesaler's license.
WINERY: A manufacturing establishment operated under the authority of a state
winemaker's license.
The following terms shall be given the meanings defined for them in the
sections of the Oklahoma alcoholic beverage control act noted in the
parentheses following each term, as follows:
   A.   Advertise the sale of alcoholic beverages (section 16);
   B.   Alcohol (section 6(1));
   C.   Alcoholic beverage (section 6(2));
   D.   Brewery (section 21(a));
   E.   Distillery (section 21(b));
   F.   Manufacturer (section 6(15));
   G.   Original package or original container (section 6(18));
   H.   Package store (section 21(g));
   I.   Person (section 6(19));
   J.   Premises (section 6(20));
   K.   Retail containers (section 6(23));
   L.   Sale (section 6 (25));
   M.   Spirits (section 6 (27));
   N.   Wholesale dealer in alcoholic beverages (section 21 (e));
   O.   Wholesaler (section 6 (28));
   P.   Wine (section 6 (29)). (Ord. 957 § 2, 1959)
9.20.020: STORE; SIGN REGULATIONS:
No person owning, operating or maintaining a retail alcoholic beverage store
shall cause or permit it to be designated by more than one sign, which shall
contain only the words "retail alcoholic liquor store", or any combination of
such words or any of them, and which shall contain no letter or figure more
than four inches (4") in height or more than three inches (3") in width and in
which the lines of words, if more than one, shall not be more than one inch
(1") apart. (Ord. 957 § 3, 1959)
9.20.030: STORE; ADVERTISING RESTRICTIONS:
No person shall advertise or cause to be advertised in any manner other than as
authorized by section
9.20.020 of this chapter, the sale of alcoholic beverages within the limits of
this city. (Ord. 957 § 4, 1959)
9.20.040: STORE; SEPARATION FROM OTHER MERCHANDISE:
No person shall maintain, operate or assist in any manner the maintenance or
operation of a retail alcoholic beverage store or package store in premises
which are not separated from adjoining premises on which any other goods, wares
or merchandise are sold or services are rendered by nontransparent walls,
broken only, if at all, by a passageway to which the public is not admitted.
(Ord. 957 § 5, 1959)
9.20.050: STORE; REMOVAL OF ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE FROM PREMISES FOR SALE OR
RESALE:
No person shall take any alcoholic beverage through any passageway described in
section
9.20.040 of this chapter for the purpose of selling or reselling such beverage,
or for the purpose of delivery thereof in connection with a sale of such
beverage. (Ord. 957 § 6, 1959)
9.20.060: STORE; SALE AND DELIVERY REGULATIONS:
   A.   No person shall sell or deliver alcoholic beverages at a retail
alcoholic beverage store other than as follows:
      1.   In retail containers; and
      2.   At ordinary room temperatures; and
      3.   In the original package; and
      4.   For consumption off the premises.
   B.   No person owning, employed in, or in any manner assisting in the
maintenance and operation of such a store shall suffer, or permit any alcoholic
beverage to be consumed, or any retail container of such beverage to be opened
on the premises of such a store. (Ord. 957 § 7, 1959)
9.20.070: STORE; CONSUMPTION ON PREMISES:
No person shall drink or consume in any manner alcoholic beverages on the
premises of a retail alcoholic beverage store, nor shall any person open or
break the seal of any original package or retail container containing alcoholic
beverages on the premises of any such retail alcoholic beverage store. (Ord.
957 § 8, 1959)
9.20.080: SALE RESTRICTED TO RETAIL ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGE STORES:
No person shall sell at retail, and no person shall deliver in consequence or
in completion of such a sale, any alcoholic beverages at any place in the city
except at a retail alcoholic beverage store in strict conformity with the
provisions of this chapter and the laws of the state of Oklahoma. (Ord. 957 §
9, 1959)
9.20.090: STORE; LOCATION RESTRICTED AND GOVERNED BY ZONING PROVISIONS:
No retail alcoholic beverage store, and no wholesale alcoholic beverage store,
warehouse, brewery, distillery, winery or any other place, however described,
for the manufacture or production or bottling of alcoholic beverages of any
kind shall be located, maintained, or operated by any person, at any place
within the boundaries of the city, except at a location at which such an
establishment is permitted by the zoning ordinance of the city. (Ord. 957 § 10,
1959)
9.20.100: STORE; UNAUTHORIZED LOCATION:
No person shall own, operate, maintain or be interested in any retail alcoholic
beverage store which is located at a place within this city which is forbidden
as a location for such store by the laws of the state of Oklahoma. (Ord. 957 §
11, 1959)
9.20.110: SALE OR GIFT OF ALCOHOL TO MINORS; POSSESSION BY MINORS:
   A.   No person shall knowingly or negligently sell, deliver, or furnish
beverages containing alcohol to any person under twenty one (21) years of age.
   B.   No minor person shall receive, possess, or use any beverage containing
alcohol.
   C.   Provided that it shall be an affirmative defense to a prosecution under
this section if the use of wine or similar beverages containing alcohol was a
part of the religious practice contained within the building and grounds of a
place of worship, and if the minor was detained within said grounds until the
effects of the alcohol were completely eliminated. However, if a minor leaves
such a religious gathering intoxicated and is found to be in public then said
providers of alcohol and the minor will each be held responsible in the same
manner as a nonreligious gathering. (Ord. 1954, 2010)
9.20.120: PERSONS UNDER TWENTY ONE YEARS; MISREPRESENTATION OF AGE:
No person under twenty one (21) years shall misrepresent his age in writing or
present false documentation of age or otherwise for the purpose of inducing any
person to sell him alcoholic beverages. (Ord. 957 § 13, 1959)
9.20.130: SALE TO INTOXICATED PERSON:
No person at any place within this city shall sell, deliver or knowingly
furnish alcoholic beverages to an intoxicated person or to any person who has
been adjudged insane or mentally deficient. (Ord. 957 § 14, 1959)
9.20.140: TRANSPORTING REGULATIONS:
No person within this city shall transport in any vehicle upon any public
highway, street or alley any alcoholic beverage, unless such alcoholic beverage
is:
   A.   In an unopened original container with seal unbroken and the original
cap or cork not removed from the container; or
   B.   In the trunk or other closed compartment or other container, out of
public view and out of reach of the driver or any occupant of the vehicle.
(Ord. 957 § 15, 1959)
9.20.150: PERSON UNDER TWENTY ONE YEARS; EMPLOYMENT PROHIBITED:
No person under the age of twenty one (21) years shall be employed in the
selling, manufacture, distribution or other handling of alcoholic beverages at
any place within this city. (Ord. 957 § 17, 1959)
9.20.160: PERSON UNDER TWENTY ONE YEARS; AIDING OR CAUSING TO BE EMPLOYED
UNLAWFUL:
No person shall employ or assist or aid in causing the employment of any person
under the age of twenty one (21) years at any place within this city, in the
selling, manufacture, distribution or other handling of alcoholic beverages.
(Ord. 957 § 18, 1959)
9.20.170: SALE; RESTRICTED ON SUNDAYS, HOLIDAYS AND ELECTION DAYS:
No person shall open for business or keep open for business, or sell or deliver
alcoholic beverages to any person at a retail alcoholic beverage store in this
city on any Sunday, New Year's Day, Memorial Day, the Fourth Of July, Labor
Day, Veterans Day, Thanksgiving Day or Christmas Day; or while the polls are
open on the day of any general, primary, runoff primary or special election,
whether national, state, county, or city, or on any other day except between
the hours of ten o'clock (10:00) A.M. and ten o'clock (10:00) P.M. (Ord. 957 §
19, 1959)
9.20.180: SELLING ON CREDIT PROHIBITED:
No person at any retail alcoholic beverage store in this city shall sell any
alcoholic beverage on credit. (Ord. 957 § 20, 1959)
9.20.190: OFFERING PREMIUMS OR PRIZES AS INDUCEMENT TO CONSUMERS:
No owner or proprietor of a retail alcoholic beverage store, and no person
employed therein, shall offer or furnish any prize, premium, gift or similar
inducement to a consumer in connection with a sale of alcoholic beverage. (Ord.
957 § 21, 1959)
9.20.200: PERSON UNDER TWENTY ONE YEARS; NOT ALLOWED ON PREMISES:
No owner or proprietor of a retail alcoholic beverage store in this city and no
person employed therein shall permit any person under twenty one (21) years of
age to enter into, to remain within or to loiter about the premises of such
retail alcoholic beverage store. (Ord. 957 § 22, 1959)
9.20.210: PERSON UNDER TWENTY ONE YEARS; LOITERING IN OR NEAR PREMISES:
No person under the age of twenty one (21) years shall enter into, remain
within or loiter about the premises of any retail alcoholic beverage store
within this city. (Ord. 957 § 23, 1959)
9.20.220: WHOLESALE SALES; RESTRICTED ON WEEKENDS, HOLIDAYS AND ELECTION DAYS:
No wholesale dealer in alcoholic beverages, and no officer, agent or employee
of such a dealer shall sell or deliver to any retail alcoholic beverage store
in this city any amount of spirits or wines on Saturday of any week, on Sunday
of any week, on New Year's Day, on Memorial Day, on the Fourth of July, on
Labor Day, on Veterans Day, on Thanksgiving Day, on Christmas Day; or while the
polls are open on the day of any general, primary, runoff primary, or special
election, whether national, state, county or city. (Ord. 957 § 24, 1959)
9.20.230: INTOXICATED PERSONS NOT ALLOWED TO REMAIN IN CLUBS, RESTAURANTS OR
PLACES OF RECREATION:
No person operating a cafe, restaurant, club or any place of recreation within
this city, and no employee engaged in connection with the operation of such a
cafe, restaurant, club or place of recreation shall permit any person to be
drunk or intoxicated in such place of business. (Ord. 957 § 25, 1959)
9.20.240: MANUFACTURE OR SALE NOT IN COMPLIANCE WITH LAW PROHIBITED:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to manufacture, barter,
sell, give away or otherwise furnish to another any intoxicating liquor or
beverage of any kind except as permitted by law, as, for example, in the case
of intoxicating liquors dispensed for medicinal, mechanical, industrial and
scientific purposes. (Prior code § 396)
9.20.250: POSSESSION OR TRANSPORTATION NOT IN COMPLIANCE WITH LAW PROHIBITED:
It shall be unlawful and an offense for any operator to knowingly transport or
for any passenger to possess in any moving vehicle upon a public highway,
street or alley any intoxicating beverages or low point beer. Provided that
transportation or possession of the beverage: a) in the original container
which shall not have been opened and from which the original cap or seal shall
not have been removed, or b) in the opened container that is located in the
rear trunk or rear compartment, which shall include the spare tire compartment
in a station wagon or panel truck, or in any outside compartment which is not
accessible to the driver or any other person in the vehicle while it is in
motion, shall not be a violation of this section. (Ord. 1874 § 1, 2006: prior
code § 397)
9.20.260: LOITERING WHERE LIQUOR IS SOLD OR FURNISHED:
It is unlawful for any person to loiter in any place where intoxicating liquor
or beverage of any kind is bartered, sold, given away or otherwise furnished
contrary to law. (Prior code § 398)
9.20.270: MAINTAINING PLACE WHERE UNAUTHORIZED SALE OR MANUFACTURE IS ALLOWED:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation, or any agent or employee
thereof to keep, maintain, or aid or abet in keeping or maintaining, a place
where intoxicating liquor is manufactured, sold, bartered, given away or
otherwise furnished in violation of the ordinances of the city. (Prior code §
399)
9.20.280: PERMITTING OR ALLOWING GATHERINGS WHERE MINORS ARE CONSUMING
ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES:
   A.   Definitions: For purposes of this section, the following definitions
shall apply:
   GATHERING: A party, gathering, or event, where a group of three (3) or more
persons have assembled or are assembling for a social occasion or social
activity.
   LEGAL GUARDIAN:
      1.   A person who, by court order, is the guardian of the person of a
minor; or
      2.   A public or private agency with whom a minor has been placed by the
court.
   MINOR: Any person less than twenty one (21) years of age.
   PARENT: A person who is a natural parent, adoptive parent, foster parent, or
stepparent of another person.
   PREMISES: Any residence or other private property, place, or premises,
including any commercial or business premises.
   RESPONSE COSTS: The costs associated with responses by law enforcement,
fire, and other emergency response providers to a gathering, including, but not
limited to:
      1.   Salaries and benefits of law enforcement, code enforcement, fire, or
other emergency response personnel for the amount of time spent responding to,
remaining at, or otherwise dealing with a gathering, and the administrative
costs attributable to such response(s);
      2.   The cost of any medical treatment for any law enforcement, code
enforcement, fire, or other emergency response personnel injured responding to,
remaining at, or leaving the scene of a gathering;
      3.   The cost of repairing any city equipment or property damaged, and
the cost of the use of any such equipment, in responding to, remaining at, or
leaving the scene of a gathering; and
      4.   Any other allowable costs related to the enforcement of this
section.
   B.   Consumption Of Alcohol By Minor In Public Place, Place Open To Public,
Or Place Not Open To Public: Except as permitted by state law, it is unlawful
for any minor to:
      1.   Consume at any public place or any place open to the public
alcoholic beverage; or
      2.   Consume at any place not open to the public any alcoholic beverage,
unless in connection with the consumption of the alcoholic beverage that minor
is being supervised by his or her parent or legal guardian.
   C.   Hosting, Permitting, Or Allowing A Party, Gathering, Or Event Where
Minors Consuming Alcoholic Beverages Prohibited:
      1.   It is the duty of any person having control of any premises, who
knowingly hosts, permits, or allows a gathering at said premises to take all
reasonable steps to prevent the consumption of alcoholic beverages by any minor
at the gathering. Reasonable steps are controlling access to alcoholic
beverages at the gathering; controlling the quantity of alcoholic beverages
present at the gathering; verifying the age of persons attending the gathering
by inspecting drivers' licenses or other government issued identification cards
to ensure that minors do not consume alcoholic beverages while at the
gathering; and supervising the activities of minors at the gathering.
      2.   It is unlawful for any person having control of any premises to
knowingly host, permit, or allow a gathering to take place at said premises
where at least one minor consumes an alcoholic beverage, whenever the person
having control of the premises either knows a minor has consumed an alcoholic
beverage or reasonably should have known that a minor consumed an alcoholic
beverage had the person taken all reasonable steps to prevent the consumption
of an alcoholic beverage by a minor as set forth in subsection C1 of this
section.
      3.   This section shall not apply to conduct involving the use of
alcoholic beverages that occurs exclusively between a minor and his or her
parent or legal guardian.
      4.   Nothing in this section shall be interpreted to prohibit any family
activity held in the confines of the family home from providing the use of
alcohol to immediate family members within the supervision of parents and
guardians. However, if a minor leaves such a family gathering intoxicated and
is found in public then said providers of alcohol will be held responsible in
the same manner as a nonfamily gathering.
      5.   Nothing in this section should be interpreted to prohibit any
religious practice which includes the use of alcohol. However, if a minor
leaves such a religious gathering intoxicated and is found to be in public then
said providers of alcohol will be held responsible in the same manner as a
nonreligious gathering.
   D.   Penalty: Any person who shall violate the provisions of this section
shall be deemed guilty of an offense against the city and upon conviction
thereof shall be punished with fine of not more than five hundred dollars
($500.00), plus all court costs and statutory penalties.
   E.   Reservation Of Legal Options: Violations of this section may be
prosecuted by the city of Okmulgee criminally, civilly, or through both
processes. The city may seek administrative fees and response costs associated
with enforcement of this section through all remedies or procedures provided by
statute, ordinance, or law. This section shall not limit the authority of peace
officers or private citizens to make arrests for any criminal offense arising
out of conduct regulated by this section, nor shall they limit the city's
ability to initiate and prosecute any criminal offense arising out of the same
circumstances necessitating the application of this section. (Ord. 1928 § 1,
2008)
CHAPTER 9.24
GAMBLING, DECEPTION AND FRAUD
SECTION:
9.24.010: Gambling Prohibited; Exception
9.24.020: Loitering In Vicinity Of Gambling Or Gaming Devices
9.24.030: Harmful Deception
9.24.040: Cheating Or Defrauding; False Checks
9.24.010: GAMBLING PROHIBITED; EXCEPTION:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation, or agent or employee
thereof, to play, to open or cause to be opened, or to operate, carry on or
conduct, whether for hire or not, any game of faro, monte, poker, roulette,
craps, any banking, percentage or other game played with dice, cards, or any
device, for money, checks, chips, credit or any other thing of value, when the
act of playing the same might result in a gain or loss to the party playing; or
to gamble knowingly in any other manner; or knowingly to permit his or its
premises, houses, lot or other property to be used in connection with, or for,
any act declared unlawful in this section; provided, that this section shall
not prohibit bingo when conducted under the auspices of a nonprofit
organization. (Prior code § 378)
9.24.020: LOITERING IN VICINITY OF GAMBLING OR GAMING DEVICES:
It is unlawful for any person to loiter about in the immediate vicinity where a
person or persons are gambling, whether by playing games, operating a slot
machine or other device, or otherwise. (Prior code § 379)
9.24.030: HARMFUL DECEPTION:
It is unlawful for any person knowingly to deceive another, whether by
impersonation, misrepresentation or otherwise, when such deception results in
or contributes to the loss, damage, harm or injury of the person deceived or of
a third party, or results in or contributes to the benefit of the deceiver.
(Prior code § 380)
9.24.040: CHEATING OR DEFRAUDING; FALSE CHECKS:
   A.   Every person who, with intent to cheat and defraud, shall obtain or
attempt to obtain from any person, firm or corporation, any money, property or
valuable thing, of a value less than five hundred dollars ($500.00) by means or
by use of any trick or deception, or false or fraudulent representation or
statement or pretense, or by any other means or instruments or device commonly
called a "confidence game", or by means or use of any false or bogus checks, or
by any other written or printed or engraved instrument or spurious coin, shall
be guilty of an offense, and upon conviction shall be punished as set forth in
section
1.12.010 of this code. The term "false or bogus check" includes checks or
orders given for money or property that are not honored on account of
insufficient funds of the maker to pay same, as against the maker thereof. The
making, drawing, issuing or delivering of a check, draft or order, payment of
which is refused by the drawee, shall be prima facie evidence of intent to
defraud and of the knowledge of insufficient funds in, or credit with, such
bank or other depository, if the instrument was presented for payment within
thirty (30) days after the same is delivered and accepted.
   B.   If such maker or drawer pays the drawee thereof the amount due on the
instrument, together with the protest fees, within ten (10) days from the date
the same is presented for payment, such payment shall be a defense to
prosecution. (Ord. 1873 § 1, 2006: Ord. 1449 § 1, 1982: prior code § 381)
CHAPTER 9.28
IMMORAL OR INDECENT CONDUCT
SECTION:
9.28.010: Definitions
9.28.020: Prostitution
9.28.030: Safe Harbor For Exploited Children
9.28.040: Specified Situations Are No Defense
9.28.050: House Of Prostitution; Residing In Unlawful (Rep. by Ord. 1986, 2012)
9.28.060: Pimps Or Procurers
9.28.070: Nudity, Improper Dress Or Indecent Exposure
9.28.080: Unlawful Public Intoxication
9.28.090: Drug Paraphernalia
9.28.010: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this chapter, the following words have the meanings ascribed:
ANAL INTERCOURSE: Contact between human beings of the genital organs of one and
the anus of another.
CUNNILINGUS: Any act of oral stimulation of the vulva or clitoris.
FELLATIO: Any act of oral stimulation of the penis.
LEWDNESS:
   A.   Any lascivious, lustful or licentious conduct,
   B.   The giving or receiving of the body for indiscriminate sexual
intercourse, fellatio, cunnilingus, masturbation, anal intercourse, or
lascivious, lustful or licentious conduct with any person not his or her
spouse, or
   C.   Any act in furtherance of such conduct or any appointment or engagement
for prostitution.
MASTURBATION: Stimulation of the genital organs by manual or other bodily
contact exclusive of sexual intercourse.
PROSTITUTION: A. The giving or receiving of the body for sexual intercourse,
fellatio, cunnilingus, masturbation, anal intercourse or lewdness with any
person not his or her spouse, in exchange for money or any other thing of
value, or
   B.   The making of any appointment or engagement for sexual intercourse,
fellatio, cunnilingus, masturbation, anal intercourse or lewdness with any
person not his or her spouse, in exchange for money or any other thing of
value. (Ord. 1986, 2012)
9.28.020: PROSTITUTION:
Engaging in prostitution, soliciting or procuring an act of prostitution,
residing or being in place for prohibited purpose, or aiding, abetting or
participating in prostitution is prohibited.
   A.   It shall be unlawful:
      1.   To engage in prostitution or lewdness;
      2.   To solicit, induce, entice, or procure another to commit an act of
lewdness, assignation, or prostitution, with himself or herself;
      3.   To reside in, enter, or remain in any house, place, building, or
other structure, or to enter or remain in any vehicle, trailer, or other
conveyance with the intent of committing an act of prostitution, lewdness, or
assignation;
      4.   To aid, abet, profit from, or participate in the doing of any of the
acts prohibited in subsection A1, A2 or A3 of this section;
      5.   To keep, set up, maintain, or operate any house, place, building,
other structure, or vehicle, trailer, or other conveyance with the intent of
committing an act of prostitution or lewdness;
      6.   To knowingly own any house, place, building, other structure, or
part thereof, or vehicle, trailer, or other conveyance used with the intent of
committing an act of lewdness or prostitution, or to let, lease, or rent, or
contract to let, lease, or rent any such place, premises, or conveyance, or
part thereof, to another with knowledge or reasonable cause to believe that the
intention of the lessee or renter is to use such place, premises, or conveyance
for prostitution or lewdness;
      7.   To offer, or to offer to secure, another with the intent of having
such person commit an act of prostitution, or with the intent of having such
person commit any other lewd or indecent act;
      8.   To receive or to offer or agree to receive any person into any
house, place, building, other structure, vehicle, trailer, or other conveyance
with the intent of committing an act of prostitution, lewdness, or assignation,
or to permit any person to remain there with such intent;
      9.   To direct, take, or transport, or to offer or agree to take or
transport, or aid or assist in transporting, any person to any house, place,
building, other structure, vehicle, trailer, or other conveyance, or to any
other person with knowledge or having reasonable cause to believe that the
intent of such directing, taking or transporting is prostitution, lewdness or
assignation;
      10.   To knowingly accept, receive, levy, or appropriate any money or
other thing of value without consideration from a prostitute or from the
proceeds of any person engaged in prostitution; or
      11.   To knowingly abet the crime of prostitution by allowing a house,
place, building, or parking lot to be used or occupied by a person who is
soliciting, inducing, enticing, or procuring another to commit an act of
lewdness, assignation, or prostitution or who is engaging in prostitution or
lewdness on the premises of the house, place, building, or parking lot. (Ord.
1986, 2012)
9.28.030: SAFE HARBOR FOR EXPLOITED CHILDREN:
   A.   A person sixteen (16) years of age or older is guilty of prostitution
when such person engages or agrees or offers to engage in sexual conduct with
another person in return for a fee.
   B.   In any prosecution for an offense under this chapter, it shall be an
affirmative defense that the actor was coerced into committing such offense by
another person.
   C.   In any prosecution of a person sixteen (16) or seventeen (17) years of
age for an offense under this chapter, there shall be a presumption that the
actor was coerced into committing such offense by another person.
   D.   A person fifteen (15) years of age or younger cannot be found guilty of
prostitution of their own person, but may be found guilty of aiding, abetting,
soliciting or transporting another for an act of prostitution. (Ord. 1986,
2012)
9.28.040: SPECIFIED SITUATIONS ARE NO DEFENSE:
   A.   In any prosecution for prostitution, or patronizing a prostitute, the
sex of the parties or prospective parties to the sexual conduct engaged in,
contemplated or solicited is immaterial.
   B.   In any prosecution for patronizing a prostitute, promoting
prostitution, or permitting prostitution, it shall be no defense that the
person engaging or agreeing to engage in sexual conduct with another person in
return for a fee could not be prosecuted for a violation, on account of such
person's age. (Ord. 1986, 2012)
9.28.050: HOUSE OF PROSTITUTION; RESIDING IN UNLAWFUL:
(Rep. by Ord. 1986, 2012)
9.28.060: PIMPS OR PROCURERS:
It is unlawful for any person to act as a pimp or procurer for any house or
place of prostitution or for any prostitute or other person engaged in an
immoral vocation, or to procure, assist in procuring or attempt to procure any
person for another for illicit sexual intercourse or for any other immoral
purpose. (Prior code § 392)
9.28.070: NUDITY, IMPROPER DRESS OR INDECENT EXPOSURE:
   A.   It is unlawful for any person to appear in any public place in the city
in a state of nudity or in any offensive, indecent or lewd dress; or to make an
indecent or offensive exposure of his or her person in public or to another
person or persons.
   B.   It shall be unlawful for any person to appear in public while wearing
pants or shorts in such a manner that the top of the pants or shorts are
located below the top of the hips, so that either: 1) undergarments known as
boxers, briefs or panties are intentionally displayed, or 2) any of the flesh
which is the division between the left and the right buttocks is displayed.
Such clothing shall be considered offensive, indecent or lewd dress for
purposes of enforcement of this code. (Ord. 1911 § 1, 2008: prior code § 394)
9.28.080: UNLAWFUL PUBLIC INTOXICATION:
   A.   As used herein, intoxication includes the consumption of alcohol, or
the use of narcotics or other controlled dangerous substances, whether such use
was with or without a physician's prescription, to a point where the person's
mental and physical faculties are materially impaired. It is unlawful for any
person to be on a public street, alley, sidewalk, place of business, park or
any other public place while in a state of intoxication and in one or more of
the following conditions:
      1.   The person's control over his or her body and faculties is so
impaired that the person is in danger of physical harm to himself or herself;
      2.   The person has threatened to harm or has harmed or appears likely to
harm another;
      3.   The person has threatened to injure or has injured or appears likely
to injure the property of another; or
      4.   The person has committed a breach of the public peace.
   B.   Any person convicted under this section shall be punished by a fine of
not more than one hundred dollars ($100.00). (Ord. 1868 § 1, 2006: prior code §
395)
9.28.090: DRUG PARAPHERNALIA:
   A.   "Drug paraphernalia" means all equipment, products and materials of any
kind which are used, intended for use, or fashioned specifically for use in
planting, propagating, cultivating, growing, harvesting, manufacturing,
compounding, converting, producing, processing, preparing, testing, analyzing,
packaging, repackaging, storing, containing, concealing, injecting, ingesting,
inhaling or otherwise introducing into the human body, a controlled dangerous
substance in violation of the uniform controlled dangerous substances act, and
includes, but is not limited to, the examples set forth in 63 Oklahoma Statutes
section 2-101 et seq.
   B.   No person shall deliver, sell, possess or manufacture drug
paraphernalia knowing, or under circumstances where one reasonably should know,
that it will be used to plant, propagate, cultivate, grow, harvest,
manufacture, compound, convert, produce, process, prepare, test, analyze, pack,
repack, store, contain, conceal, inject, ingest, inhale or otherwise introduce
into the human body a controlled dangerous substance in violation of that
portion of the uniform controlled dangerous substances act found at 63 Oklahoma
Statutes section 2-405. (Ord. 2021, 2014)
CHAPTER 9.32
NARCOTICS
SECTION:
9.32.010: Use, Possession Or Sale Of Narcotics
9.32.010: USE, POSSESSION OR SALE OF NARCOTICS:
   A.   It is unlawful for any person to possess, in any quantity, a controlled
dangerous substance as defined in either state or federal law, except it shall
not be unlawful for any person to possess marijuana in quantities defined by
state law, if that person holds a valid medical marijuana card issued by the
Oklahoma Medical Marijuana Authority.
   B.   It is unlawful for any person to possess a controlled substance
requiring a prescription within the city limits, unless the person in
possession has a valid prescription for said substance.
   C.   Each substance possessed may be separate violations. Violation of this
Ordinance shall be punishable by a fine of up to $500.00 per incident, or up to
six (6) months in jail. (Ord. 2165 § 1, 2022: Ord. 1868 § 2, 2006)
CHAPTER 9.36
DANCING
SECTION:
9.36.010: Hours And Days Not Permitted; Minors Restricted
9.36.020: Unlawful Where Nonintoxicating Beverages Sold
9.36.010: HOURS AND DAYS NOT PERMITTED; MINORS RESTRICTED:
   A.   It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to operate, conduct
or supervise, or assist in the operation, conduct or supervision of, any dance
where the public is permitted to dance, at any time on Sunday or between one
o'clock (1:00) A.M. and seven o'clock (7:00) A.M. on any other day.
   B.   It is unlawful for any person under the age of eighteen (18) years to
enter or be in a place at a dance where the public is permitted to dance unless
such person is accompanied by a parent or guardian, or is properly chaperoned
by a responsible person; or for any person operating, conducting or
supervising, or assisting in the operation, conduct or supervision of, such a
dance, knowingly to permit such a person under eighteen (18) years of age to
remain in such place. (Prior code § 291)
9.36.020: UNLAWFUL WHERE NONINTOXICATING BEVERAGES SOLD:
   A.   It is unlawful for any person to dance in any place within the limits
of the city where nonintoxicating beverages as defined by 37 Oklahoma Statutes,
1951, section 163.2 are either sold, furnished, kept for sale, stored or
consumed.
   B.   It is unlawful for any person who either owns, operates, leases,
manages, supervises or is employed in any place where nonintoxicating beverages
as defined by 37 Oklahoma Statutes, 1951, section 163.2 are either sold,
furnished, kept for sale, stored or consumed, to permit or allow any person or
persons to dance therein. (Prior code § 292)
CHAPTER 9.40
DISTURBING THE PEACE
SECTION:
9.40.010: Unlawful Assembly
9.40.020: Disturbing The Peace; Insulting Others
9.40.030: Disturbing Religious Worship
9.40.040: Disturbing Public Assembly
9.40.050: Loud Noises Or Music; Exceptions
9.40.060: Display Of Insulting Signs
9.40.070: Ridiculing Religion
9.40.080: Keeping A Disorderly House
9.40.090: Creating A Public Disturbance
9.40.010: UNLAWFUL ASSEMBLY:
It is unlawful for two (2) or more persons to assemble together or, being
assembled together, to act in concert to do any unlawful act against the peace
or to the terror of others, or to make any movement thereto or any preparation
therefor or otherwise to assemble together unlawfully or riotously. (Prior code
§ 404)
9.40.020: DISTURBING THE PEACE; INSULTING OTHERS:
It is unlawful for any person to disturb the peace of another or others by
violent, obstreperous or improper conduct or carriage, by loud or unusual
noise, or by unseemly, obscene, offensive or abusive language; or to insult
another or others by such conduct or language. (Prior code § 405)
9.40.030: DISTURBING RELIGIOUS WORSHIP:
It is unlawful for any person to disturb any congregation or assembly of
persons meeting for religious worship by making noise, by rude, indecent or
improper behavior, by profane, improper or loud language, or in any other
manner, either within the place of worship or within hearing distance thereof.
(Prior code § 406)
9.40.040: DISTURBING PUBLIC ASSEMBLY:
It is unlawful for any person to disturb any lawful public gathering or
assembly by making noise, by rude, indecent or improper behavior, by profane,
improper or loud language, or in any other manner, either within the place of
assembly or within hearing distance thereof. (Prior code § 407)
9.40.050: LOUD NOISES OR MUSIC; EXCEPTIONS:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to disturb the peace and
quietude of any part of the city by operating, having operated, or permitting
to be operated, any contrivance, whether electric or not, with or without a
loudspeaker, in such a manner as to emit loud music, noise or words. Provided,
however:
   A.   It shall not be unlawful for a civic organization, having first
obtained the consent of the city council, to operate a loudspeaker and/or other
sound equipment in public places upon such terms and within such hours as
prescribed by the city council;
   B.   It shall not be unlawful for a business or industry to emit sounds that
do not exceed sixty five decibels (65 dB) for a period of eight (8) hours or
less in any twenty four (24) hour period, as measured at the property line of
such business or industry. (Ord. 1653 § 1, 1989: Ord. 1590 § 1, 1986: prior
code § 408)
9.40.060: DISPLAY OF INSULTING SIGNS:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person, firm or corporation within the
city to display any sign, emblem, badge, flag or device which in its common
acceptance is insulting, profane or abusive to the citizens of the city, and
which is calculated, or of which the natural consequence is, to cause a breach
of the peace or an assault. (Prior code § 409)
9.40.070: RIDICULING RELIGION:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person to circulate any literature or use
any language within the corporate limits of the city that casts profane
ridicule on God, Jesus, or religion which in its common acceptance is
calculated to cause a breach of the peace or an assault. (Prior code § 410)
9.40.080: KEEPING A DISORDERLY HOUSE:
Every person who keeps any disorderly house or any house of public resort by
which the peace, comfort, or decency of the immediate neighborhood is
habitually disturbed, is guilty of a misdemeanor. By way of example and not as
a definition, a disorderly house shall include any habitable structure from
which neighbors are repeatedly subjected to or confronted with loud and raucous
music, public drunkenness, urination in public, fistfights, shouting of
obscenities or similar disturbances observable from locations off of the
property. If there have been police responses to the property at least four (4)
times during a four (4) consecutive month period on complaints for conduct that
has disturbed the neighborhood, the residents of the house and any person in
charge thereof shall be presumed to have known about and accepted the conduct
giving rise to the complaints. (Ord. 1888 § 1, 2007)
9.40.090: CREATING A PUBLIC DISTURBANCE:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person to knowingly or wilfully create a
public disturbance. As used herein, a "public disturbance" is defined as: a)
any generation of loud noise or a gathering of people exhibiting such
obstreperous behavior that such noise or behavior actually results in calls by
individual members of the public for police response to such disturbance, or b)
the use of harassing, threatening, abusive or profane language or gestures
which are heard or visible from public areas, said language or gestures being
directed toward other members of the public or toward officers in plain view.
It shall be sufficient for a prosecution for the use of harassing, threatening
or profane language or gestures, if the language or gestures can be seen by the
person or persons against whom they are directed, whether or not the persons
against whom they are directed respond by actually being intimidated. (Ord.
1985, 2012)
CHAPTER 9.44
SHOWS AND SHOOTING GALLERIES
SECTION:
9.44.010: Shows, Exhibitions And Entertainment; Hours And Subject Matter
Restricted
9.44.020: Shooting Galleries; Construction And Operation Standards
9.44.010: SHOWS, EXHIBITIONS AND ENTERTAINMENT; HOURS AND SUBJECT MATTER
RESTRICTED:
   A.   It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to show moving
pictures for profit or to persons who pay admission charges to view them at any
time between the hours of two o'clock (2:00) A.M. and one o'clock (1:00) P.M.
on Sunday.
   B.   It is unlawful to show vile, obscene or immoral moving pictures at any
time, or to give any kind of a show, exhibition or entertainment which is vile,
obscene or immoral, at any time. (Prior code § 293)
9.44.020: SHOOTING GALLERIES; CONSTRUCTION AND OPERATION STANDARDS:
   A.   Every shooting gallery constructed, established, set up or operated in
this city shall be constructed, established, set up and operated in accordance
with the standards, specifications and requirements of 63 Oklahoma Statutes,
supp. 1955, sections 701 – 708, and shall comply with all the requirements
thereof. No shooting gallery shall be operated in this city until a license has
been secured therefor in accordance with the chapter. Any violation of any
provision of this section or of any provision of 63 Oklahoma Statutes, supp.
1955, sections 701 – 708 shall be deemed an offense against the city, and shall
be punishable as such. (Prior code § 294)
CHAPTER 9.48
VAGRANCY, UNWELCOME SOLICITATION AND LOITERING
SECTION:
9.48.010: Vagrancy; Defined
9.48.020: Vagrancy; Prohibited
9.48.030: Dangerous Or Unwelcome Solicitation
9.48.050: Loitering; After Twelve O'Clock Midnight Or Near Schools
9.48.060:   Use Of Parks/Public Facilities For Hygiene Prohibited
9.48.010: VAGRANCY; DEFINED:
The following persons are vagrants within the meaning of this chapter:
   A.   An idle person who lives without any means, or who has no visible means
of support and makes no exertion to obtain a livelihood by honest employment;
   B.   Any person who strolls or loiters idly about the streets of the city,
having no local habitation and no honest business or employment;
   C.   Any person who strolls about to tell fortunes or to exhibit tricks not
licensed in accordance with law or ordinance;
   D.   Any common prostitute, any manager or controller of a house of
prostitution or ill fame or anyone employed therein as a barkeeper, caller of
figures for dances or habitual frequenter thereof;
   E.   Any professional gambler or gambler commonly known as a tinhorn
gambler, card player or cardsharp;
   F.   Any person who goes about to beg alms, who is not afflicted or disabled
by a physical malady or misfortune;
   G.   Any habitual drunkard;
   H.   Any person who abandons or neglects or refuses to support his family.
(Prior code § 382)
9.48.020: VAGRANCY; PROHIBITED:
It is unlawful for any person to be a vagrant in the city, and any person who
is a vagrant in the city shall be punished as provided by the ordinances of the
city. (Prior code § 383)
9.48.030: DANGEROUS OR UNWELCOME SOLICITATION:
It shall be unlawful for any person: a) to solicit the donation of money or
other valuable property from an individual, or b) to solicit employment,
business contributions or sales of any kind, or c) to collect money from the
occupant of any vehicle traveling upon any public street or highway. These
prohibitions apply when such solicitation or collection activity involves the
person performing the activity: a) to enter the building or grounds of a
private business without the express permission of the manager thereof; or b)
to enter onto the traveled portion of a public street or highway to complete
the transaction, including, without limitation, entering onto bike lanes, turn
lanes, street gutters or vehicle parking areas; or c) the solicitation or
collection cannot be performed completely without the solicitor or the person
being solicited blocking the free flow of traffic by others such as (but not
limited to) causing the driver of a vehicle to remain stationary while facing a
green light at a controlled intersection of a public street; or d) to cause the
person being solicited to be intimidated or concerned for personal safety,
provided that such intimidation or concern is to be judged against what might
intimidate or concern a reasonable person under the applicable circumstances
and conditions; or e) after the person being solicited has expressly
communicated a desire for the solicitation to cease. (Ord. 2046, 2014)
9.48.050: LOITERING; AFTER TWELVE O'CLOCK MIDNIGHT OR NEAR SCHOOLS:
   A.   It is unlawful for any person, without lawful reason, between the hours
of twelve o'clock (12:00) midnight and sunrise, to loiter or wander aimlessly
within the city on the streets, in other public places or on property of
another; or during such time to sleep on any street, in any other public place,
or on any property of another without the expressed or tacit consent of the
owner or person in charge of such place.
   B.   It is unlawful for a person to loiter on or about the premises of a
public or private school, or in or about any other public building, or in or
about a depot of a public carrier. (Prior code § 386)
9.48.060: USE OF PARKS/PUBLIC FACILITIES FOR HYGIENE PROHIBITED:
It shall be unlawful for a person to use or attempt to use public access water
facilities intended for recreational or landscape use, such as pools, splash
pads, sprinkler systems or water faucets for the private purpose of personal
hygiene to wash their body, clothing or hair, or for animal hygiene. (Ord. 2207
§ 1, 2024)
CHAPTER 9.52
INTERFERENCE WITH OR INJURY TO PROPERTY
SECTION:
9.52.010: Throwing Advertising Matter On Street
9.52.030: Destroying Or Defacing Buildings Or Property
9.52.040: Placing Signs, Inscriptions, Etc., On Property Of Others
9.52.050: Throwing Or Shooting Objects At Persons Or Property
9.52.060: Tampering With Or Damaging Public Utilities
9.52.070: Unlawful Intrusion Upon Land
9.52.080: Illegal Entrance Onto Property
9.52.100: Trespasses Prohibited
9.52.110: Specific Trespasses Enumerated
9.52.120: Content Of Notice To Be Exhibited
9.52.130: Exceptions
9.52.140: Penalties
9.52.150: Vehicular Trespass Prohibited
9.52.160: Penalties For Vehicular Trespass
9.52.170: Dumping Of Trash, Refuse Or Debris Prohibited
9.52.180: Encroachments And Obstructions On Streets And Sidewalks Prohibited
9.52.190: Prowling Prohibited
9.52.010: THROWING ADVERTISING MATTER ON STREET:
It is unlawful for any person to throw, leave or deposit, or cause to be
thrown, left or deposited upon any street, alley, sidewalk, or other public
area, any handbill, circular, or other advertising matter. (Prior code § 296)
9.52.030: DESTROYING OR DEFACING BUILDINGS OR PROPERTY:
   A.   It is unlawful for any person to destroy, injure, deface, besmear, or
molest any structure, outbuilding, fence, or any other property, real,
personal, public or private, belonging to another; or to use any such property
wrongfully to the detriment of the owner or other person entitled to its use;
or to interfere wrongfully with the use of any such property by its owner or
any other person entitled to its use.
   B.   It is unlawful for any person to destroy, injure, deface, besmear, or
molest any utility meter or the electronic equipment associated therewith. Any
person upon conviction for a violation of this subsection shall be fined in an
amount not less than four hundred dollars ($400.00), but not more than the
maximum fine allowed by ordinance plus court costs, the fees and mileage of
witnesses. (Ord. 1956, 2010)
9.52.040: PLACING SIGNS, INSCRIPTIONS, ETC., ON PROPERTY OF OTHERS:
It is unlawful for any person to place, stick, tack, paste, post, paint, mark,
write or print any sign, poster, picture, announcement, advertisement, bill,
placard, device or inscription upon any public or private building, fence,
sidewalk, bridge, viaduct, post, automobile, other vehicle or other property of
another, without the consent of the owner or person in charge thereof. (Prior
code § 416)
9.52.050: THROWING OR SHOOTING OBJECTS AT PERSONS OR PROPERTY:
It is unlawful for any person to throw or shoot any stone, shot or other object
into or across any street or alley, or in any place where he is likely to hit
another person wrongfully or to injure property, or to throw or shoot any
stone, shot or other object at any person, vehicle, structure, electric light
or other property of another, whether public or private, except in case where
such is done in defense of oneself, of another person or of property. (Prior
code § 417)
9.52.060: TAMPERING WITH OR DAMAGING PUBLIC UTILITIES:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person to connect or attach any kind of
pipe, hose, device, wire or other contrivance to any pipe, line, wire or other
conductor carrying gas, water, sanitary sewage, stormwater or electricity and
belonging to a public utility (whether publicly or privately owned), in such a
manner as to enable any person to consume or use the utility system without it
passing through a properly installed meter owned by or acceptable to the city
in the opinion of the city manager or his/her designee or in any other way so
as to evade payment therefor, or to receive benefit from such an unlawful
connection. It is also unlawful for any person to damage, molest, tamper with,
or destroy any water main, sanitary sewer main, storm sewer main or inlet
structure, pipe, line, wire, meter, valve or other part of any public utility,
including telegraph and telephone systems. (Ord. 1733 § 1, 1998: prior code §
418)
9.52.070: UNLAWFUL INTRUSION UPON LAND:
Every person who intrudes or squats upon any lot or piece of land within the
city without license or authority from the owner thereof, or who erects or
occupies thereon any hut, hovel, shanty or other structure without such license
or authority; and every person who places, erects or occupies within the bounds
of any street, alley or avenue of the city, any hut, hovel, shanty or other
structure whatever is guilty of a misdemeanor. (Prior code § 419)
9.52.080: ILLEGAL ENTRANCE ONTO PROPERTY:
It is unlawful for any person to enter upon the property of another or into an
area or structure on such property, whether such property, area or structure is
public or private when such entrance is plainly forbidden by signs or
otherwise, or when the property, area or structure is enclosed, except when
such entrance is in line of duty, or with the expressed or tacit consent of the
owner or person in charge, or otherwise by authority of law or ordinance; or to
fail or refuse to leave such premises immediately after the owner or person in
charge or any agent thereof requests or orders him to leave. (Prior code § 420)
9.52.100: TRESPASSES PROHIBITED:
It is unlawful and an offense for any person, firm or corporation to commit a
trespass within this city upon either public or private property. (Ord. 1734 §
1, 1998)
9.52.110: SPECIFIC TRESPASSES ENUMERATED:
Any of the following acts by any person, firm, or corporation shall be deemed a
violation of section
9.52.100 of this chapter, as amended:
   A.   An entry upon the premises, or any part thereof, of another in
violation of a notice exhibited thereon prohibiting entry at specified times;
or
   B.   An entry upon the premises, or any part thereof, of another in
violation of any notice, warning or protest given orally or in writing by any
owner or occupant thereof; or
   C.   An entry upon any public property, including parks or parking areas, in
violation of a notice exhibited thereat prohibiting entry at specified times;
or
   D.   An entry upon any public property in violation of any notice, warning
or protest given orally or in writing by a city official; or
   E.   If on the property of another, or upon public property, lawfully, a
failure or refusal to depart in case of being requested to so depart orally or
written, by any owner or occupant, or by a city official; or
   F.   An entry upon any portion of a public park, during regular hours, where
such entry is specifically prohibited or where the entry involves the use of
any vehicle, equipment or device where such use is specifically prohibited, or
where the entry otherwise involves acts or conduct which is specifically
prohibited. (Ord. 1734 § 1, 1998)
   G.   The City Manager or his/her designee may maintain a registry containing
the address and identification of property owners who voluntarily request to
have the Okmulgee Police Department remove trespassers from their property
without prior notice to the property owner. The property owner shall post no
trespassing signs or have property that is enclosed by fencing or other
contiguous barrier in order for citation for trespass and/or immediate removal
of offenders by the Okmulgee Police Department. Property that is not posted as
required within this chapter shall not qualify for citation or immediate
removal of alleged trespassers until after a warning is provided by Okmulgee
Police as provided in this chapter. Nothing herein creates an affirmative or
special duty on the City of Okmulgee or the Okmulgee Police Department to
patrol or inspect the properties on the register in any manner other than
general observance of all property within the City of Okmulgee. Nothing herein
relieves a property owner from notifying the Okmulgee Police Department if
there is a good faith basis to believe a trespass is occurring on their
property. (Ord. 2208 § 1, 2024: Ord. 1734 § 1, 1998)
9.52.120: CONTENT OF NOTICE TO BE EXHIBITED:
For purpose of constituting a violation of section
9.52.100 of this chapter, the exhibited notice required under subsections
9.52.110A and C of this chapter shall meet the following criteria:
   A.   The notice shall be plainly posted in a place or places conspicuous to
those who would enter the property;
   B.   The notice shall be legible so as to afford reasonable warning prior to
the commission of a trespass;
   C.   If upon property to which the public is invited at least some part of
the day, the notice shall clearly specify the days and times of day entry is
prohibited, and further specify that entry at such times constitutes a
punishable offense under this chapter. (Ord. 1734 § 1, 1998)
9.52.130: EXCEPTIONS:
Subsections
9.52.110A and C of this chapter shall not apply to agents, servants or
employees of property owners or occupants where such agents, servants or
employees have been duly authorized entry upon posted property. (Ord. 1734 § 1,
1998)
9.52.140: PENALTIES:
Any person, firm or corporation violating the provisions of section
9.52.100 of this chapter by committing any of the acts enumerated in section
9.52.110 of this chapter shall be guilty of an offense and upon conviction
therefor shall be subject to one- half (1/2) of the maximum penalty as set
forth in section
1.12.010 of this code, plus court costs and each day an offense continues shall
be considered a separate offense. (Ord. 1867 § 4, 2006: Ord. 1734 § 1, 1998)
9.52.150: VEHICULAR TRESPASS PROHIBITED:
No person, firm or corporation shall park, leave or place any "vehicle", as
defined by section
10.04.350 of this code, as amended, upon any public or private property without
the owner's consent, except where such property is provided for public parking
and the use for such parking is not restricted by proper notice. (Ord. 1734 §
1, 1998)
9.52.160: PENALTIES FOR VEHICULAR TRESPASS:
   A.   Any person, firm or corporation violating the provisions of section
9.52.150 of this chapter shall be guilty of an offense and upon conviction
therefor shall be subject to one-half (1/2) of the maximum penalty as set forth
in section
1.12.010 of this code, plus court costs, and each day an offense continues
shall be considered a separate offense.
   B.   Any person, firm or corporation violating the provisions of section
9.52.150 of this chapter, shall have the vehicle so parked, left or placed
subject to impoundment upon complaint of the property owner or occupant, and
shall be wholly responsible for payment of towage and/or storage charges. (Ord.
1867 § 4, 2006: Ord. 1734 § 1, 1998)
9.52.170: DUMPING OF TRASH, REFUSE OR DEBRIS PROHIBITED:
   A.   Any person who places, dumps, throws, abandons, drops, deposits or
discards any garbage, trash, waste, unwanted item or items, rubbish, refuse,
debris or other deleterious substance on any public property, ditch, park,
street, highway, alley, sidewalk, street or highway shoulder or other public
way or on any private property of another, including, but not limited to, in a
polycart, container or dumpster not issued to him or his business by the city,
without consent, commits a trespass and shall be guilty of a misdemeanor
offense.
   B.   Any person convicted of violating the provisions of subsection A of
this section shall be subject to one-half (1/2) of the maximum penalty set
forth in section
1.12.010 of this code, plus court costs, and each day that an act or a
violation occurs or continues shall constitute a violation of this section, and
be construed as a separate offense.
   C.   In addition to the penalty prescribed by subsection B of this section,
the court may direct the person to make restitution to the property owner
affected, whether public or private; to pick up, remove and properly dispose
of, or cause to be picked up, removed and properly disposed of, the garbage,
trash, waste, unwanted item or items, rubbish, refuse, debris or other
deleterious substance from the property, whether public or private, at his/her
sole expense; or any combination of the foregoing which the court, in its
discretion, deems appropriate. The dates, times and locations of such
activities shall be scheduled by the chief of police or his/her designee
pursuant to the order of the court in such a manner as not to unreasonably
interfere with the employment or family responsibilities of the person.
   D.   Any full time peace officer in municipal law enforcement and any other
employee of the city having peace officer authority or code enforcement
authority upon investigation of the disposal of any substance in violation of
this section which contains two (2) or more items bearing a common address in a
form which tends to identify the latest owner of the items shall create a
rebuttable presumption that all competent persons residing at such address
committed the unlawful act. (Ord. 1867 § 4, 2006: Ord. 1744 § 1, 1999)
9.52.180: ENCROACHMENTS AND OBSTRUCTIONS ON STREETS AND SIDEWALKS PROHIBITED:
   A.   The following words and phrases defined in this subsection, when used
in this chapter, shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this subsection:
   PUBLIC RIGHT OF WAY: A strip of land dedicated to the public, in fee simple
or by easement, to be occupied or intended to be occupied by a street,
crosswalk, sidewalk, railroad, roadway, electric transmission line, oil or gas
pipeline, water main, sanitary or storm sewer main, drainage structure, or for
another special use.
   ROADWAY: That portion of a street improved, designed or ordinarily used for
vehicular travel, exclusive of the sidewalk.
   SIDEWALK: That portion of a public right of way between the curb lines or
the lateral lines of a roadway and the adjacent property lines, whether
improved or unimproved, intended for use of pedestrians.
   STREET: The entire width between boundary lines of every public right of way
when any part thereof is open to the use of the public for purposes of
vehicular travel.
   STRUCTURE: Anything that is built or constructed.
   B.   No person, firm or corporation shall locate, place, lay upon, position,
attach, fasten, affix, store, install, construct, assemble or build any
structure, whether permanent or temporary, designed and/or used to house,
store, protect or shelter a motor vehicle(s) on, over or across a street and/or
a sidewalk.
   C.   A nonconforming use of a street and/or a sidewalk which exists on the
effective date of this section shall be discontinued within six (6) months of
the effective date of this section. A nonconforming use of a street and/or a
sidewalk which continues after or beyond such six (6) month period is
prohibited and constitutes an offense.
   D.   No nonconforming use of a street and/or a sidewalk shall be created or
established on or after the effective date of this section and such creation or
establishment of a nonconforming use on or after the effective date of this
section constitutes an offense. (Ord. 1792 § 1, 2002)
9.52.190: PROWLING PROHIBITED:
   A.   It is prohibited and a violation of this section for any person to go
onto the private property of another, from eleven o'clock (11:00) P.M. until
sunrise, without the owner or occupier's knowledge and consent.
   B.   This prohibition shall not apply to any portion of the property that is
dedicated to travel in any form including rights of way, street easements,
sidewalk easements on any land, or the parking lots of commercial buildings.
This prohibition shall not prohibit a person from walking directly from a
portion of the property that is dedicated to travel and proceeding directly to
the main or public entrance of an occupied building for the purpose of knocking
or otherwise announcing the person's presence. This prohibition shall not
prohibit a person employed as a utility worker from entering property within
the utility easement while on duty, and in order to inspect, repair, or gather
data from the employer's utility facility. (Ord. 1921 § 1, 2008)
CHAPTER 9.56
PETIT LARCENY, RECEIVING STOLEN PROPERTY AND MOLESTING VEHICLES
SECTION:
9.56.010: Larceny Defined And Prohibited
9.56.020: Possession Of Stolen Property
9.56.030: Molesting Automobiles Or Other Vehicles
9.56.040: Failure To Return Certain Leased Or Rented Property
9.56.010: LARCENY DEFINED AND PROHIBITED:
   A.   “Petit Larceny” is the taking of personal or intangible property of
value not to exceed one thousand dollars ($1,000), without consent, with intent
to deprive another thereof.
   B.   “Larceny” is the taking of personal or intangible property, regardless
of value, with the intent to deprive another thereof, that is not “Petit
Larceny”, and includes all Larceny regardless of value that is not otherwise
governed by state law.
   C.   Each offense may be charged as separate violations.
   D.   Petit Larceny or Larceny is unlawful, and any person who commits an
offense shall be guilty of a misdemeanor. (Ord. 2166 § 1, 2022: Ord. 1824 § 1,
2003: Ord. 1450 § 1, 1982: prior code § 412)
9.56.020: POSSESSION OF STOLEN PROPERTY:
It is unlawful for any person to buy, receive, possess or bring into the city
any property which the person knows or reasonably should know has been stolen.
(Ord. 2167 § 1, 2022: Prior code § 413)
9.56.030: MOLESTING AUTOMOBILES OR OTHER VEHICLES:
It is unlawful for any person to crank, start, otherwise meddle with, molest,
enter, occupy, loiter in, take or drive away any automobile or other vehicle
belonging to another, without the consent of the owner or person in charge
thereof. (Prior code § 414)
9.56.040: FAILURE TO RETURN CERTAIN LEASED OR RENTED PROPERTY:
Any person having any item of personal property in his possession or under his
control by virtue of a lease or rental agreement who wilfully and fraudulently
fails to return said item of personal property within ten (10) days after the
lease or rental agreement has expired, or who fraudulently secretes or
appropriates said property to any use or purpose not within the due and lawful
execution of his lease or rental agreement shall be guilty of embezzlement.
(Ord. 1639 § 1, 1988)
CHAPTER 9.60
SALES OF MERCHANDISE IN PUBLIC
SECTION:
9.60.010: Sale Of Personal Property On Or In Vacant Property; Consent Required
9.60.020: Auctions On Public Streets Or Sidewalks Unlawful; Exception
9.60.010: SALE OF PERSONAL PROPERTY ON OR IN VACANT PROPERTY; CONSENT REQUIRED:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation, including a civic or
religious organization, to sell, barter, trade or transfer any merchandise,
wearing apparel or other personal property of any kind on or in any vacant
property in the city without the consent of the owner or person in control of
the property. (Prior code § 289)
9.60.020: AUCTIONS ON PUBLIC STREETS OR SIDEWALKS UNLAWFUL; EXCEPTION:
It is unlawful for any person to hold any public or private auction for sale of
property on any of the streets or sidewalks of the city; provided, that this
section shall not apply to the sale of property under any lien, execution or
order of any court of the state or of the United States of America. (Prior code
§ 290)
CHAPTER 9.64
RESIDENTIAL SALES
SECTION:
9.64.010: Residential Sale Defined
9.64.020: Exemptions From Provisions
9.64.030: License; Required; Separate For Each Location
9.64.040: License; Application
9.64.050: License; Issuance
9.64.060: License; Revocation
9.64.070: Proceeds Subject To Sales Tax
9.64.080: Advertising Signs Or Devices Limited
9.64.090: Display Of Goods
9.64.100: License; Fee
9.64.110: Violation; Penalty
9.64.010: RESIDENTIAL SALE DEFINED:
Whenever used in this chapter, unless otherwise clearly indicated by the
context, the term "residential sale" means any sale held out to be, or commonly
known as a garage, porch, room, back yard, front yard or patio sale, or any
other type of general sale conducted from or on any premises not located in a
zoning district which permits such sales where goods or articles of any type
are held out for sale to the public; provided, however, that this definition
shall not include a situation where specific items are held out for sale and
all advertisement of such sale specifically names the items to be sold. (Ord.
1213, 1974)
9.64.020: EXEMPTIONS FROM PROVISIONS:
The provisions of this chapter shall not apply to or affect the following
persons:
   A.   Persons acting pursuant to an order or process of a court of competent
jurisdiction;
   B.   Persons acting in accordance with their powers and duties as public
officials:
   C.   Duly licensed auctioneers selling at auctions;
   D.   Civic or religious organizations holding sales to raise funds for their
organizations. (Ord. 1529 §§ 1, 2, 1984: Ord. 1443 § 1, 1982: Ord. 1213, 1974)
9.64.030: LICENSE; REQUIRED; SEPARATE FOR EACH LOCATION:
   A.   It is unlawful and an offense for any person to hold, conduct, engage
in or participate in any manner, in a residential sale without having first
obtained a license, as provided for in this chapter: provided, however, that
the issuance of a license under the provisions of this chapter shall not exempt
such persons from the terms and provisions of any other ordinance of the city.
   B.   A separate license shall be required for each location at which a
residential sale is to be held.
   C.   No license shall be issued if a residential sale has been held or
conducted at the location for which a license is requested within six (6)
months next preceding the date of said application. (Ord. 1529 § 3, 1984: Ord.
1443 § 2, 1982: Ord. 1213, 1974)
9.64.040: LICENSE; APPLICATION:
An applicant for a license under the provisions of this chapter shall furnish
the city clerk with the following information:
   A.   Full name and address of applicant;
   B.   The location at which the proposed residential sale is to be held;
   C.   Serial or identification number of each article to be sold; if it is
obtainable;
   D.   The date, or dates upon which the sale shall be held;
   E.   An affidavit from the applicant to the effect that all goods to be sold
at the subject residential sale are owned by the applicant and have not been
obtained for the purpose of reselling the articles at the sale. (Ord. 1213,
1974)
9.64.050: LICENSE; ISSUANCE:
   A.   The city clerk is authorized to grant a license for a residential sale
for a period not to exceed two (2) consecutive days to any person applying
therefor and who otherwise complies with the requirements of this chapter and
the other ordinances of the city; provided, however, that when a residential
sale is not held on the dates for which the license is issued or is terminated
during the first day of such sale because of inclement weather conditions, and
an affidavit by the license holder to this effect is submitted, the city clerk
may issue another license to the applicant for a residential sale to be
conducted at the same location within thirty (30) days from the date when the
first sale was to be held.
   B.   Before issuing a residential sale license, the city clerk may conduct
such investigation as may reasonably be necessary to determine if there is
compliance with this chapter and other ordinances of the city. (Ord. 1213,
1974)
9.64.060: LICENSE; REVOCATION:
Any license issued under this chapter may be revoked, or any application for
issuance of such license may be refused by the city clerk in the event the
ordinances of this city are not complied with or if the application submitted
by the applicant, or license holder, contains any false, fraudulent, or
misleading statement. (Ord. 1213, 1974)
9.64.070: PROCEEDS SUBJECT TO SALES TAX:
All proceeds from sales conducted under this chapter are subject to sales tax
as provided for by state law and title 3,
chapter 3.12 of this code. Permit holders are responsible for the proper
reporting of sales and the remittance of taxes. (Ord. 1529 § 4, 1984)
9.64.080: ADVERTISING SIGNS OR DEVICES LIMITED:
Not more than one sign or other device used for the purpose of advertising, or
otherwise calling attention to a residential sale, shall be allowed for each
residential sale licensed under this chapter. The sign or device shall be
located on the immediate premises where the sale is to be conducted, but in no
event shall the sign or device be more than two hundred feet (200') from the
sale area. The display surface of such sign or device shall not exceed twelve
(12) square feet on each side. (Ord. 1213, 1974)
9.64.090: DISPLAY OF GOODS:
The sale area at any residential sale shall be confined to the premises for
which the license has been issued, and in no event shall articles or goods be
so displayed as to attract attention or be conspicuously in view from any
public street. (Ord. 1213, 1974)
9.64.100: LICENSE; FEE:
There is levied a fee of five dollars ($5.00) for a residential sale license,
which shall be paid to the city clerk before issuance of said license. (Ord.
1443 § 4, 1982: Ord. 1325 § 4, 1977: Ord. 1213, 1974)
9.64.110: VIOLATION; PENALTY:
Any person who violates the provisions of this chapter shall be subject to a
fine as set forth in section
1.12.010 of this code. (Ord. 2008, 2013)
CHAPTER 9.66
LARCENY OF CABLE TELEVISION SERVICES
SECTION:
9.66.010: Larceny Of Cable Television Services Prohibited
