CHAPTER 11.02
GENERAL PROVISIONS
SECTION:
11.02.010: Purpose And Scope
11.02.020: Firearms, Fireworks And Explosives Prohibited
11.02.030: Peace And Quiet
11.02.040: Destroying Or Defacing Buildings Or Property
11.02.050: Alcoholic Beverages; Public Intoxication
11.02.060: Rubbish
11.02.070: Prohibited Area
11.02.080: Fires And Burning
11.02.090: Animals
11.02.100: Pesticides Prohibited
11.02.110: Soliciting Prohibited
11.02.120: Cumulative Of Other Ordinances
11.02.130: Penalty
11.02.010: PURPOSE AND SCOPE:
The purpose of this title is to establish a system of rules and regulations to
control activity on Okmulgee Lake and Dripping Springs Lake. Unless a rule or
regulation is restricted specifically to either Okmulgee Lake or Dripping
Springs Lake, it shall apply to both. When reference is made to Okmulgee Lake
or to Dripping Springs Lake, it shall mean not only the body or bodies of water
so designated, but shall include the shore and land area or areas surrounding
same and owned by the City.
   A.   Any references herein to the Okmulgee State Park or State park official
are hereby designated to refer to the Okmulgee Lake, and its official shall be
the City Manager, Okmulgee law enforcement or its designee.
   B.   The City Council may from time to time impose usage fees or permits for
continued operating expenses at Okmulgee Lake and/or Dripping Springs Lake.
Failure to pay said fees shall be a violation of this chapter and shall be
subject to citation and fine imposed in this title. (Ord. 2098, 2017: Ord. 1930
§ 2, 2008)
11.02.020: FIREARMS, FIREWORKS AND EXPLOSIVES PROHIBITED:
   A.   No person shall carry or posses a firearm with a cartridge in any
portion of the mechanism; nor shall any person discharge across, in, or into
any portion of the Okmulgee Lake area or Dripping Springs Lake area a firearm,
bow and arrow, or air or gas weapon or any device capable of injuring or
killing any person or animal or damaging or destroying any public or private
property, except that certain firearms shall be permitted when lawfully hunting
or as hereinafter provided.
   B.   No person shall possess, discharge, set off, or cause to be discharged
in or on any portion of the Okmulgee Lake area and/or the Dripping Springs Lake
area, firecrackers, torpedoes, rockets, fireworks, all explosives, or substance
harmful to the life or safety of persons, or capable of damaging public or
private property. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.02.030: PEACE AND QUIET:
To ensure peace and adequate rest, no person shall so conduct himself that he
in a disorderly manner disturbs others.
Without limiting the foregoing, no person shall shout, sing, play radios,
phonographs, televisions, or other such electronic or mechanical instruments,
in such manner that same emits sound beyond the immediate area between the
hours of ten o'clock (10:00) P.M. and six o'clock (6:00) A.M. daily. No person
shall, at any time, use outside electric equipment including electrical
speakers at a volume which emits sound beyond the immediate area, without first
obtaining a written permit from Okmulgee State Park. (Ord. 2098, 2017: Ord.
1930 § 2, 2008)
11.02.040: DESTROYING OR DEFACING BUILDINGS OR PROPERTY:
No person shall destroy, injure, deface, besmear, or molest any structure,
building, outbuilding, fence, or any other property, real or personal, public
or private, belonging to another. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.02.050: ALCOHOLIC BEVERAGES; PUBLIC INTOXICATION:
No person shall possess, consume or inhale any intoxicating substance of any
kind. Substances containing more than 3.2 percent alcohol by weight are deemed
intoxicating. Nor shall any person be within the area of Okmulgee Lake and/or
Dripping Springs Lake in a state of intoxication. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.02.060: RUBBISH:
No person shall leave, deposit, drop, or scatter bottles, broken glass, ashes,
wastepaper, cans, or other rubbish except in receptacles designated for that
purpose, or in the event no receptacles are available all such items shall be
packed out of the area. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.02.070: PROHIBITED AREA:
To ensure the safety and health of persons; or to avoid interference in
development, construction, and management; or to provide for the security,
safeguarding and preservation of property, the City Manager or Okmulgee State
Park may from time to time declare a prohibited area, specify the period
therefor, and may from time to time, revoke, suspend, repeal, or modify such
order. A notice declaring a prohibited area shall be posted. The order may
specify such reasonable classes of persons who may enter therein in the conduct
of proper activities or official duties as the City Manager or Okmulgee State
Park may prescribe. When by order a prohibited area has been so declared, no
person so prohibited shall enter therein during the effective period thereof.
(Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.02.080: FIRES AND BURNING:
No person shall burn, set afire, or cause to be set afire, for any purpose
other than cooking, and only then in receptacles provided for that purpose. If
no receptacles are available there shall be no burning or fire. (Ord. 1930 § 2,
2008)
11.02.090: ANIMALS:
   A.   No person shall bring a dog or pet into, permit a pet to enter or
remain, or possess a pet unless said animal is leashed, caged, confined in a
vehicle, or otherwise restrained, so as to be under the direct physical control
of a person. (Verbal control is not implied.) Any dog found running loose or
which may be chasing or running any game may be destroyed in conformance with
title 6,
chapter 6.20 of this Code.
   B.   No person shall bring a pet into, permit a pet to enter or remain, or
possess any pet at any swimming pool or controlled beach area. Nor will any pet
be allowed to swim at or around any marina or fishing dock.
   C.   No person shall bring a dog or cat into, permit to enter or remain, or
possess a dog or cat unless the person can present proof that the said dog or
cat has a current, valid rabies inoculation including the name of the serum
used and the date of the inoculation.
   D.   No person shall keep a noisy, vicious, or otherwise dangerous animal,
or one which is disturbing to other persons, and allow said animal to remain
therein if directed by any Okmulgee State Park official to remove said animal.
   E.   Subsections A and B of this section shall not apply to all certified
service animals used to guide the person to whom the animal has been registered
while using facilities, providing that said animal shall remain under the
immediate control of the person to whom the animal has been registered. (Ord.
2098, 2017: Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.02.100: PESTICIDES PROHIBITED:
   A.   No person shall disperse or otherwise apply any pesticide whether to
the air, water, ground, or vegetation. Exception is made in the instance of
dispersal within enclosed buildings, tents, tent trailers, or within any
vehicle or boat containing living or sleeping quarters, or the use outdoors
within ten feet (10') of the table, stove, tent or food lockers, of handheld
finger operated aerosol dispensers with net contents not to exceed twenty (20)
ounces and containing any of the following pesticides: pyrethine, allethrin,
piperonyl butoxide, malathion, DDVP (dichlores, vapona), dibrom, rotenone
(dirrin, cube root) or any pesticide not registered with the EPA or which falls
into the classification of "restricted use pesticide" so as to conform with the
Federal Environment Pesticide Act.
   B.   No person other than Federal, State, or local agency employees
conducting a pest control program previously approved in writing by the City
Manager or an Okmulgee State Park official shall operate any high volume air,
propane, or power driven pesticide dispenser or fogging device. (Ord. 1930 § 2,
2008)
11.02.110: SOLICITING PROHIBITED:
No person shall hawk or peddle any goods, wares, merchandise, liquids, or
edibles for human consumption or distribute circulars. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.02.120: CUMULATIVE OF OTHER ORDINANCES:
The regulations set forth in this title are not to be considered the exclusive
laws and regulations pertaining to the lake areas but are to be considered
together with all other applicable ordinances of the City; the other ordinances
of the City shall apply when applicable and not in conflict with the provisions
of this title. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.02.130: PENALTY:
Any person who violates any provision of this chapter, shall be guilty of an
offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined as provided in section
1.12.010 of this Code. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
CHAPTER 11.04
CAMPING
SECTION:
11.04.010: Camping Authorized In Designated Areas
11.04.020: Unauthorized Camping
11.04.030: Time Limits
11.04.040: Penalty
11.04.050: Fees
11.04.060: Dump Station Fee - Non-Campers
11.04.010: CAMPING AUTHORIZED IN DESIGNATED AREAS:
Camping shall be allowed in designated areas, so designated by the Okmulgee
City Manager or his/her designee. (Ord. 2168 § 1, 2022: Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.04.020: UNAUTHORIZED CAMPING:
No person shall camp or undertake any activities generally associated with
camping in any area not designed as a camping area. (Ord. 2168 § 1, 2022: Ord.
1930 § 2, 2008)
11.04.030: TIME LIMITS:
Time limits shall be set by the Okmulgee City Manager or his/her designee.
(Ord. 2168 § 1, 2022: Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.04.040: PENALTY:
Any person who violates any provision of this chapter, shall be guilty of an
offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined as provided in section
1.12.010 of this code. (Ord. 2168 § 1, 2022: Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.04.050: FEES:
Fees for camping per day on Lake Okmulgee and Dripping Springs Lake shall be as
designated:
RV (electric/water) $22.00 and $20.00 senior/veteran discount.
Full hookup (only one at Red Oak) $25.00 and $23.00 senior/veteran discount.
Primitive $13.00 and $11.00 senior/veteran discount.
Group Camp - Dripping Springs (electric/water) $20.00 and $18.00 senior/veteran
discount. (Ord. 2168 § 1, 2022)
11.04.060: DUMP STATION FEE - NON-CAMPERS:
Anyone using one (1) of the dumping stations at Lake Okmulgee or Dripping
Springs Lake, that is not currently utilizing a camp site, shall pay a five
dollars ($5.00) per dump. (Ord. 2209 § 1, 2024)
CHAPTER 11.06
SWIMMING
SECTION:
11.06.010: Swimming Prohibited In Okmulgee Lake And Dripping Springs Lake,
Except In Designated Areas
11.06.020: Swimming Hours
11.06.030: Penalty
11.06.010: SWIMMING PROHIBITED IN OKMULGEE LAKE AND DRIPPING SPRINGS LAKE,
EXCEPT IN DESIGNATED AREAS:
No person shall swim or wade in any waters of Okmulgee Lake or Dripping Springs
Lake that have not been designated and posted as swimming areas, or as approved
by special written permits from Okmulgee state park officials. (Ord. 1930 § 2,
2008)
11.06.020: SWIMMING HOURS:
Notwithstanding any other provision contained in this code, no person shall
swim or wade in the waters of Okmulgee Lake or Dripping Springs Lake during the
nighttime hours from sundown to sunup. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.06.030: PENALTY:
Any person who violates any provision of this chapter, shall be guilty of an
offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined as provided in section
1.12.010 of this code. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
CHAPTER 11.08
HUNTING
SECTION:
11.08.010: Migratory Waterfowl Hunting Permitted; State Law To Apply; Shotguns
Only
11.08.020: State Hunting License Required
11.08.030: Waterfowl Hunting Blinds
11.08.040: Penalty
11.08.010: MIGRATORY WATERFOWL HUNTING PERMITTED; STATE LAW TO APPLY; SHOTGUNS
ONLY:
Hunting by any means on Lake Okmulgee or Dripping Springs Lake shall be
prohibited with the exception that hunting for migratory waterfowl shall be
allowed during the lawful open season therefor, by means of shotgun only;
provided:
   A.   No person shall hunt with a rifle of any size or caliber.
   B.   No person shall take, shoot, kill or trap any quail or doves upon said
premises at any time.
   C.   No person shall take or kill more wild ducks or wild geese than
permitted by the state of Oklahoma and/or United States laws.
   D.   No person shall shoot or kill any game birds or nongame birds or
animals at any time, either in daytime or nighttime, when such shooting is
prohibited by state of Oklahoma or United States laws. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.08.020: STATE HUNTING LICENSE REQUIRED:
No person shall hunt upon Lake Okmulgee or Dripping Springs Lake without having
upon their person and in their possession a current and valid hunting license
issued by the state of Oklahoma. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.08.030: WATERFOWL HUNTING BLINDS:
Waterfowl hunting blinds shall be classified as temporary blinds constructed
for only one hunting trip and removed at the end of said trip. Hunters
utilizing temporary blinds must be at least sixteen (16) years of age and
possess a valid state of Oklahoma hunting license and signed migratory bird
hunting and conservation stamp. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.08.040: PENALTY:
Any person who violates any provision of this chapter, shall be guilty of an
offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined as provided in section
1.12.010 of this code. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
CHAPTER 11.10
FISHING
SECTION:
11.10.010: Commercial Fishing Prohibited
11.10.020: Sport Fishing; Prohibited Means Of Taking Fish
11.10.030: Bag Limit On Game Fish
11.10.040: State Fishing License Required
11.10.050: Floating Fishing Dock Regulations
11.10.060: Fishing Tournaments
11.10.070: Bow Fishing
11.10.080: Penalty
11.10.010: COMMERCIAL FISHING PROHIBITED:
No person may net, trap or seine for commercial purposes or assist in such
operations or buy, barter or trade any fish upon Lake Okmulgee or Dripping
Springs Lake. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.10.020: SPORT FISHING; PROHIBITED MEANS OF TAKING FISH:
Sport fishing shall be allowed upon Lake Okmulgee and Dripping Springs Lake;
provided, no person may use at any time for taking, catching or killing fish
any of the following instrumentalities:
   A.   Any trotline or throwline to which more than seventy five (75) hooks
are attached, such hooks being spaced not less than twenty four inches (24")
apart. Provided further, that any lines used must:
      1.   Have the name of the owner attached thereto;
      2.   Not be set within three feet (3') of the surface of the water at any
point beyond six feet (6') from either point of attachment; and
      3.   Be attended once every twenty four (24) hours.
   B.   Any rotenone or other poison, dynamite or other explosive or any
electrical device used for shocking purpose.
   C.   Any net, trap, spear, trammel net or seine of any kind. (Ord. 1930 § 2,
2008)
11.10.030: BAG LIMIT ON GAME FISH:
   A.   The following are classified as game fish in Oklahoma under 29 Oklahoma
Statutes section 2-115. "Game fish" is a fish normally sought after by
sportsmen, and includes only largemouth bass, smallmouth bass, white bass,
spotted bass, black crappie, white crappie, northern pike, trout, sauger,
saugeye, striped bass, walleye, blue catfish and channel catfish. "Blue
catfish" and "channel catfish" are herein defined to mean "forked tail"
catfish.
   B.   It shall be illegal to take game fish of any length by any means other
than by hook and line.
   C.   The angler may take game fish not in excess of the amounts set forth
below in any one day as measured from twelve o'clock (12:00) midnight to the
immediately following twelve o'clock (12:00) midnight.
Species Daily Catch Limit
Species                               Daily Catch Limit
Largemouth, smallmouth and/or spotted 6 aggregate (only 1 in excess of 22
black bass                            inches from Dripping Springs Lake)
Channel and/or blue catfish           15 aggregate
Crappie                               25 aggregate
Rock bass (goggle eye)                Unlimited
Trout                                 10 aggregate
Walleye pike                          3 aggregate
White bass                            Unlimited
 
Provided, that as regards largemouth, smallmouth and/or spotted black bass
taken at Lake Okmulgee there is established a slot length limit of twelve (12)
to fifteen inches (15"). That by virtue of the slot length limit, those fish
measuring at least twelve inches (12"), but no more than fifteen inches (15"),
are not to be taken from the lake and must be released when caught.
Provided, further, that as regards largemouth, smallmouth and/or spotted black
bass at Dripping Springs Lake there is a slot length limit of seventeen (17) to
twenty two inches (22"). That by virtue of the slot length limit those fish
measuring at least seventeen inches (17"), but no more than twenty two inches
(22"), are not to be taken from the lake and must be released when caught; only
one fish over twenty two inches (22") may be taken from the lake. (Ord. 1952 §
1, 2010: Ord. 1942 § 1, 2009: Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.10.040: STATE FISHING LICENSE REQUIRED:
No person shall fish upon Lake Okmulgee or Dripping Springs Lake without having
upon his or her person and in his or her possession a current and valid fishing
license issued by the state of Oklahoma. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.10.050: FLOATING FISHING DOCK REGULATIONS:
The city council hereby authorizes the city manager and Okmulgee state park
officials to formulate policies pertaining to floating fishing docks. (Ord.
1930 § 2, 2008)
11.10.060: FISHING TOURNAMENTS:
Tournament fishing may occur upon either Lake Okmulgee or Dripping Springs Lake
upon receipt of a license issued by the city of Okmulgee to the event sponsor,
and subject to the following:
   A.   The fishing tournament shall be conducted in such a way that it does
not upset the natural habitat of Lake Okmulgee or Dripping Springs Lake, nor
deplete either of the lakes of fish. No nets, debris, felled trees or other
devices may be placed in the lake and used to restrict the natural movement of
fish or prevent access to any part of the lake by other boaters.
   B.   The fishing tournament shall be conducted as catch and release only.
Therefore, all boats must be equipped and use live wells or comparable devices
to preserve the life of the catch. If culling of fish is allowed by the
tournament rules, no angler may cull a dead fish.
   C.   All fishing tournament participants shall be required to possess and
carry any fishing licenses required by the state of Oklahoma. Individual life
preservers or comparable flotation devices shall be available to each occupant
of each boat.
   D.   The fishing tournament participants shall be required to comply with
all applicable ordinances, laws, rules and regulations of the city of Okmulgee
as the owner of the lakes and those of the state of Oklahoma as the lessee of
portions of the lake properties.
   E.   All fishing tournaments shall allow only mouth caught fish. Snagging of
fish or trapping with nets or other devices is prohibited. Only one rod per
angler may be used at any one time. Other rods may be present in the boat, so
long as no more than one is in use by any angler at any time; this means that
any cast must be fully retrieved before a different rod is put to use.
   F.   All fishing tournaments shall follow the Oklahoma department of
wildlife conservation publication entitled "Fish Care Guidelines For Tournament
Directors", including the "other release considerations", unless expressly
excused by the city council.
   G.   Tournaments shall be limited to Monday through Friday only, during the
period from Memorial Day to Labor Day inclusive. For the time period from Labor
Day to Memorial Day but excluding those named weekends, tournaments may be
conducted on any day or set of days described in the license.
   H.   Tournament participants shall be limited to a total of no more than
thirty (30) boats in any tournament. The total number of persons in each boat
shall not exceed the manufacturer's recommended load limits.
   I.   Any violation of the rules set forth herein may be handled by the
tournament authorities as a matter of internal discipline. However, violation
of subsections A through E, inclusive, of this section is prohibited and may
also subject any offender to prosecution in municipal court.
   J.   Tournament sponsors may apply to the city for a license, providing an
application fee of one hundred fifty dollars ($150.00), describing the event
proposed, providing a copy of the event rules, and providing either liability
insurance or the written guarantee that the event participants carry their own
individual insurance. In no event shall the city be liable for any accident
occurring during or in connection with a tournament. (Ord. 2022, 2014: Ord.
2015, 2013)
11.10.070: BOW FISHING:
The following species of fish may be taken by bow and arrow: shad, buffalo,
carp, drum, gar, flatheads, snakes, frogs, and turtles. Provided, that the
following regulations shall apply to bow fishing:
   A.   No bow lighter than thirty (30) pounds shall be used and no arrow with
more than three (3) points or with more than two (2) barbs on each point shall
be permitted. One end of a line not lighter than forty (40) pound test shall be
attached to the arrow, the other end of the line to be attached either to the
bow or to a fishing rod with reel.
   B.   Archers shall be permitted to shoot from reservoir banks, boat, or
while wading in shallow water but in no case shall be permitted to shoot in the
direction of other archers, fishermen, buildings, boats or in any direction
except downward into the water. Such fishing shall be permitted between sunup
and twelve o'clock (12:00) midnight only. No fish shall be left in the water or
at any other place on the lake reservation, the removal and disposition of fish
being the sole responsibility of archery fishermen.
   C.   All state and federal regulations regarding the use of bow and arrow
for the taking of such fish and snakes must be observed by the archer;
providing that trotlines may be used. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.10.080: PENALTY:
Any person who violates any provision of this chapter, shall be guilty of an
offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined as provided in section
1.12.010 of this code. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
CHAPTER 11.12
BOATING AND SKIING
SECTION:
11.12.010: Boating Regulations
11.12.020: Boats Or Watercraft Allowed On Dripping Springs Lake
11.12.030: Skiing; Where Authorized; Regulations
11.12.040: Towing Away And Impounding Boats; Okmulgee Police And Authority;
Conditions
11.12.050: Penalty
11.12.060: Boat Ramp Use Fee
11.12.010: BOATING REGULATIONS:
All boating on Lake Okmulgee or Dripping Springs Lake shall comply with 63
Oklahoma Statutes chapters 70, 71, 72 and 73; sections 4000 through 4257 and
subsequent as amended by the state of Oklahoma. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.12.020: BOATS OR WATERCRAFT ALLOWED ON DRIPPING SPRINGS LAKE:
No boat or other watercraft of any type shall be used or operated on Dripping
Springs Lake that is not primarily intended for use for fishing or duck
hunting, including, but not limited to, jet skis, jet boards, water bikes and/
or sailboards or other similar vessels or craft. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.12.030: SKIING; WHERE AUTHORIZED; REGULATIONS:
   A.   Waterskiing is prohibited upon the waters of Dripping Springs Lake.
   B.   Waterskiing is allowed upon the waters of Lake Okmulgee, and the
following regulations shall apply:
      1.   Coast guard approved life vests shall be worn by all skiers.
      2.   Waterskiing shall be allowed only during daylight hours from sunup
to sundown each day.
      3.   The ski towboat shall have either a second person in the boat, in
addition to the driver, or a rear vision mirror for observing the person being
towed.
      4.   Towropes shall not be less than seventy five feet (75') in length.
      5.   Not more than two (2) skiers may be towed by any one boat at the
same time. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.12.040: TOWING AWAY AND IMPOUNDING BOATS; OKMULGEE POLICE AUTHORITY;
CONDITIONS:
   A.   Members of the Okmulgee police department are authorized and empowered
to remove a boat and/or boat trailer from Lake Okmulgee or Dripping Springs
Lake, and to impound the same in a place of safety under any of the following
circumstances:
      1.   When any boat and/or boat trailer has been left unattended for a
period in excess of twenty four (24) hours.
      2.   When any boat has been left unattended in an area whereby it
constitutes a definite hazard or obstruction to the normal movement of traffic.
      3.   In conjunction with the arrest of the operator for violation of any
of the provisions of this title.
   B.   A boat and/or boat trailer impounded as provided in this section shall
be delivered back to the owner or such other person to whom it may be properly
delivered only after such fine or fines and costs as may be properly assessed
by the municipal judge for the violation or violations for which such vehicle
was impounded, if any, and all reasonable costs or charges for impounding and
storage shall have been paid. (Ord. 2168 § 2, 2022: Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.12.050: PENALTY:
Any person who violates any provision of this chapter, shall be guilty of an
offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined as provided in section
1.12.010 of this code. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.12.060: BOAT RAMP USE FEE:
A Boat Ramp Use Fee of $2.00 to be incurred upon each type of water craft
launched from any boat ramp on Lake Okmulgee or Dripping Springs Lake. Said fee
will be placed in Iron Rangers installed at each boat ramp location. (Ord. 2168
§ 2, 2022)
CHAPTER 11.14
VEHICLES AND VEHICLE OPERATORS
SECTION:
11.14.010: Reference To Motor Vehicle Codes
11.14.020: Speed Limit
11.14.030: Road Designation
11.14.040: No Restricted Access On Designated Roads
11.14.050: Registration
11.14.060: Vehicle Operation
11.14.070: Removal Of Vehicles
11.14.080: Use Of Roads
11.14.090: Penalty
11.14.010: REFERENCE TO MOTOR VEHICLE CODES:
The provisions of 47 Oklahoma Statutes chapters 1 through 80; sections 1-101
through 1603 as they are applicable to highways and roads within Okmulgee state
park and Dripping Springs state park are hereby adopted. Likewise, the
provisions of title 10 of this code as they are applicable to highways and
roads within Okmulgee state park and Dripping Springs state park are hereby
adopted. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.14.020: SPEED LIMIT:
No person shall drive a vehicle at a speed greater than is reasonable or
prudent, having due regard for traffic conditions, the surface and width of the
road, and in no event at a speed which endangers the safety of person,
property, or wildlife, provided, however, that in no event shall a vehicle be
driven at a speed greater than fifteen (15) miles per hour in camps, picnic
areas, utility areas, or headquarter areas or in areas where the general public
assembles; provided further, that in no event shall a vehicle be driven at a
speed greater than thirty five (35) miles per hour in all other areas. (Ord.
1930 § 2, 2008)
11.14.030: ROAD DESIGNATION:
All existing paved, macadamized, blacktopped, chatted, graveled or otherwise
improved roads are declared designated roads and deemed for ingress, egress and
interarea traveling by registered vehicles, as provided in section
11.14.050 of this chapter, subject to such special conditions and limitations
as may have been or may hereafter be imposed pursuant to section
11.02.070 of this title, council resolution or ordinance. A road consisting of
only a dirt bed or earth cut shall not be considered a "designated road" unless
clearly posted as a "designated road". Such posting and designation may provide
for restrictions or limitations on the classes or types of vehicles permitted
on such road as determined by order of the city manager or Okmulgee state park
officials; provided, that should any road consisting of only a dirt bed or
earth cut be designated, or designated with limitations or restrictions by the
city manager or Okmulgee state park officials, said road shall also be clearly
posted to inform the public that said road is not maintained, rugged, and that
vehicles enter and use such road at their own risk. Reference alone to off
highway use vehicle or off road vehicle does not in itself thereby imply
authorization to operate or use the same off of designated roads. Such
operation and use is governed by other provisions herein. Only those trails,
areas, or roads designated for use by off road vehicles may be used for the
operation of off road vehicles and same shall be clearly posted:
Un-maintained Off-Road Vehicle Trail
(Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.14.040: NO RESTRICTED ACCESS ON DESIGNATED ROADS:
No gate, chain or other device will be installed upon or across a "designated
road" except by order of the city manager or Okmulgee state park officials as
provided for elsewhere herein. All gates, chains or other devices existing or
installed upon "designated roads" on the date of enactment hereof shall be
immediately dismantled and removed unless authorized by proper order of the
city manager or Okmulgee state park officials. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.14.050: REGISTRATION:
Only those vehicles registered under 47 Oklahoma Statutes section 51 may be
operated, used, or parked provided, however, that off road vehicles may operate
on such roads and places as may be specifically designated therefor under other
regulations herein subject to any special conditions, limitations, or
restrictions for a given road. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.14.060: VEHICLE OPERATION:
No person shall operate, drive, use, leave, place, park or stop a vehicle,
except on a road or a parking area not closed to traffic; nor shall any person
operate or park a vehicle in violation of the conditions, limitations, or
restrictions upon such road; nor operate, park or leave a vehicle subject to,
and in violation of, closing hours; nor in such manner as to pursue, harass,
endanger, or injure any form of wildlife; nor in violation of any portion of
state law applicable to vehicle operation within the state. (Ord. 1930 § 2,
2008)
11.14.070: REMOVAL OF VEHICLES:
Any officer of the Okmulgee police department or any employee of Okmulgee state
park is authorized to cause the removal of a vehicle from the highways,
driveways, paths, or grounds when such vehicle is parked or left standing in
violation of title 10 of this code. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.14.080: USE OF ROADS:
   A.   Horseback Riding; Hitching: No person shall ride, drive, lead or keep a
saddle horse or other animal except on such roads, beaches, trails, or areas so
designated and posted. No horse or other animal shall be hitched to any tree,
shrub, or structure in any manner that may cause damage thereto.
   B.   Bicycles: All regulations and ordinances applying to the operation of
vehicles shall apply to the operation of bicycles except those provisions which
by their nature can have no application. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.14.090: PENALTY:
Any person who violates any provision of this chapter, shall be guilty of an
offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined as provided in section
1.12.010 of this code. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
CHAPTER 11.16
VIOLATIONS
SECTION:
11.16.010: Penalty For Violations
11.16.010: PENALTY FOR VIOLATIONS:
Any person who shall violate, attempt to violate, or who counsels or aids
another to violate or attempt to violate, any of the provisions of this title,
or the lawful rules that may be made under authority of this title shall be
deemed guilty of an offense and upon conviction thereof shall be penalized as
provided in title 1,
chapter 1.12 of this code. The violation of any of the rules and regulations
herein or of any of the laws of the state of Oklahoma or of the United States
is hereby prohibited, and any person or persons violating the said rules or
laws shall be subject to immediate ejectment from Lake Okmulgee and Dripping
Springs Lake areas and immediate cancellation of any license or permit provided
for herein, if held by the offenders; and the repeated violation by any person
or persons shall render such person ineligible to obtain future licenses or
privileges or to enter upon said property, and Okmulgee police officers or
Okmulgee state park officials are hereby authorized and directed to take all
necessary steps to prosecute in the proper court or courts any person or
persons violating the said rules, regulations and laws upon said property.
(Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
CHAPTER 11.18
BOAT DOCKS, BOAT RAMPS AND OTHER LAKE ACCESS STRUCTURES
SECTION:
11.18.010: Definitions
11.18.020: Scope
11.18.030: Boat Docks Permitted
11.18.040: Number Of Docks And Preferred Locations
11.18.050: General Issues Affecting Boat Docks/Lake Access Sites
11.18.060: Permitting Requirements And Eligibility
11.18.070: Construction Standards
11.18.080: Right Of Inspection
11.18.090: Penalty
11.18.010: DEFINITIONS:
As used in this chapter, the following terms shall have the meanings
respectively ascribed to them in this section, unless the context clearly
requires a different meaning:
BOAT DOCK: Piers, wharves, floating boathouses, docks, and other floating
structures of a stationary or semistationary nature, extending into the lands
and waters of the city, including all attachments, such as stiff-arms, spars,
approaches, anchorages, walkways or gangplanks.
BOAT RAMP: A concrete driveway providing a method of launching a boat into
Okmulgee Lake.
CALIPER: The size of a tree trunk (normally measured by circumference).
LAKE ACCESS: Any method, manner, structure, etc., of crossing city property in
order to reach the waters of Okmulgee Lake or Dripping Springs Lake.
LAKE ACCESS PERMIT: A permit issued by the city under certain conditions
allowing use of city property to provide access to Okmulgee Lake by various
means.
LAKE LEASE: An executed agreement between the city of Okmulgee and a person,
firm or corporation, allowing for use of a designated piece of city property
surrounding Okmulgee Lake for certain purposes specified in the agreement.
REVOCATION OF PERMIT: Cancellation of a permit for any reason.
SHORELINE: For the purpose of these rules and regulations, the seven hundred
foot (700') mean sea level elevation surrounding Lake Okmulgee. (Ord. 1930 § 2,
2008)
11.18.020: SCOPE:
This chapter shall apply to rules and regulations for both Lake Okmulgee and
Dripping Springs Lake. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.18.030: BOAT DOCKS PERMITTED:
No boat docks shall be permitted on Dripping Springs Lake. Private boat docks
will be allowed on Lake Okmulgee by permit but no commercial boat docks will be
allowed or operated. No person, firm or corporation may construct, install,
relocate or operate any wharf, dock, boat ramp, landing, anchorage, boathouse
or barge on the waters or shorelands of Lake Okmulgee until and unless a boat
dock/lake access permit shall have been issued by the city. (Ord. 1930 § 2,
2008)
11.18.040: NUMBER OF DOCKS AND PREFERRED LOCATIONS:
   A.   Number Of Boat Docks/Lake Access Sites:
      1.   The maximum number of private boat docks and/or lake access sites on
Lake Okmulgee shall be twenty five (25).
      2.   There shall only be one boat dock/lake access site allowed for each
adjoining property owner or city leaseholder.
   B.   Preferred Locations:
      1.   The intent of the city is that all structures extending into the
lands and waters of the city be so located as to minimize the obstruction of
travel over the lands and waters of the city, and that they be so located,
attached and secured as to keep to a minimum that amount of encroachment
necessary on the lands and waters of the city. Only one means of ingress/egress
shall be permitted per dock.
      2.   Sites located in small coves (limited open water) are preferred in
order to maximize general public access to open water areas. (Ord. 1930 § 2,
2008)
11.18.050: GENERAL ISSUES AFFECTING BOAT DOCKS/LAKE ACCESS SITES:
   A.   No boat dock or boat ramp will be allowed to be built on the lake that
adversely impacts the general use and activities on Lake Okmulgee. As such, due
care and diligence shall be exercised by the city council of the city of
Okmulgee in considering applications for docks/access sites to be located on
Lake Okmulgee.
   B.   In evaluating all applications, minimizing the impact on the use of the
lake by all recreational users shall be the primary consideration.
   C.   By permit, the owner of any boat dock or lake access site shall be
allowed one means of ingress and egress to same across land owned by the city
of Okmulgee and/or the shoreline by one route which shall not exceed fifteen
feet (15') in width and shall be preapproved by both Okmulgee state park and
the city of Okmulgee. The contour of the land and potential erosion shall be
taken into consideration for all access routes. Said means of ingress and
egress shall be maintained by the permit holder.
   D.   Written applications shall be submitted and written approval shall be
received prior to any clearing, grubbing, or construction whatsoever; provided
that mowing shall not be prohibited by this section.
   E.   No commercial operation shall be allowed on or operated from the dock.
(Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.18.060: PERMITTING REQUIREMENTS AND ELIGIBILITY:
   A.   New Boat Docks/Lake Access Sites:
      1.   Applicant must fill out an application for a boat dock/lake access
permit and submit it to the city clerk.
      2.   Application (form provided by the city of Okmulgee).
      3.   A city representative will inspect the proposed boat dock/lake
access location and submit the application and a recommendation to the Okmulgee
city council. If the application is granted, permit holder has one year to
construct a dock/access site unless permit holder gets a written extension from
the Okmulgee city council. If permit holder fails to have his/her boat dock/
lake access site completed within one year and does not get an extension, the
permit will be revoked and the opportunity to apply shall be given to the next
person on the waiting list.
   B.   Selection Process:
      1.   Upon passage hereof, notice of the initial application period shall
be posted at Okmulgee city hall and published in the "Okmulgee Daily Times".
The initial application period shall run for two (2) months.
      2.   At the end of the initial application period, a list will be
compiled of all applications received. The list will be prioritized based upon
the length of time an applicant has owned or leased his/her property with those
owning or leasing their property the longest being given the highest priority.
This will be determined by the records on file with the Okmulgee County clerk.
A property transfer for estate planning purposes only shall not affect the
priority ranking of an application, but any other transfer shall cause the
applicant to lose priority on the list. Said list of applications shall then be
evaluated by Okmulgee state park and a city of Okmulgee representative and a
recommendation for approval or denial of the application will be submitted to
the Okmulgee city council for action at a city council meeting.
      3.   In the event the number of qualified applications received exceeds
the number of available permits, the excess applications shall be retained and
will serve as a waiting list for future available permits subject to the same
priority criteria as stated above. Applicants submitting their application
after the initial application period shall be placed on the waiting list in the
appropriate priority based on time of ownership or lease, relative to all other
applicants on the waiting list.
      4.   In the event someone on the waiting list sells his/her property, the
priority position on the waiting list is not transferable. The new property
owner must submit a new application and will be assigned the appropriate
priority ranking on the list based on their date of acquisition.
      5.   In the event the number of applications is less than the number of
available permits, application may be made at any time for an available permit
by an otherwise qualified party.
   C.   Fees; Penalty; Permit Revocation:
      1.   Fee Changes; Due Date: Fees will initially be two hundred forty
dollars ($240.00) per boat dock/lake access site per year, but may be changed
in the future by resolution of the Okmulgee city council. The due date of said
fees shall be on or before January 1 of any calendar year and shall be
considered as payment for the upcoming calendar year.
      2.   Penalty: Failure to pay said fee when due shall result in two (2)
late notices being sent, each with a twenty five dollar ($25.00) penalty.
Failure to pay within two (2) weeks after the late notices are sent shall
result in revocation of the permit.
      3.   Permit Revocation: Upon revocation of a permit for any reason, any
structure will be required to be removed within a period of time set by the
city manager. If the structure is not removed within said period of time, the
structure may be removed by the city of Okmulgee at the expense of the former
permit holder. The revoked permit shall then be deemed to be an available
permit and be offered to the next person on the waiting list. Any person having
had a previous permit revoked shall be eligible to submit a new application and
be placed at the bottom of the waiting list.
   D.   Eligibility: To be eligible to submit an application for a boat dock/
lake access permit, a person must either lease property from the city of
Okmulgee or own property either of which joins city property lying below the
seven hundred foot (700') mean sea level elevation surrounding Lake Okmulgee.
(Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.18.070: CONSTRUCTION STANDARDS:
   A.   Floating Boat Dock Standards:
      1.   All electrical appurtenances and improvements shall be installed and
serviced by an electrician currently holding a license with the city of
Okmulgee and the state of Oklahoma. All electrical work shall be in conformance
with the national electrical code or other electrical code adopted by the city
of Okmulgee at that time, all following the obtaining of all necessary and
appropriate permits.
      2.   All flotation will be enclosed Styrofoam, minimum size four feet by
four feet (4' x 4').
      3.   No enclosed boat docks or walkways shall be permitted.
      4.   No wood below the water line shall be permitted.
      5.   All metals are required to be the type commonly used by professional
boat dock builders, i.e., 16-gauge or larger galvanized cee or zee purlin; two
inch (2") square or round tubing.
      6.   Plans showing details of construction and location of the boat dock
must be submitted along with the application.
      7.   Spacing shall be no closer than fifty feet (50') from the nearest
point of adjacent boat dock.
      8.   All specifications are minimum unless otherwise stated.
      9.   All docks shall be so constructed as to allow the water level to
vary in the lake from a point one foot (1') above the top of the spillway to a
point seven feet (7') below the top of the spillway during times of varying
water supply in the lake.
   B.   Walkway Requirements:
      1.   Length: Maximum forty feet (40') unless exception thereto approved
by the city of Okmulgee.
      2.   Width: Maximum four feet four inches (4'4").
      3.   Flotation: Enclosed flotation as required to keep walkway afloat.
      4.   Materials: Frame made of two inch by six inch (2" x 6") cee or zee
purlin, 16-gauge galvanized steel.
      5.   Handrail: Must have two (2) handrails and be made from one inch (1")
or two inch (2") square or round steel.
      6.   Flooring: Two inch by six inch (2" x 6") treated lumber or
comparable metal or synthetic wood.
      7.   Horizontal Support: A minimum of every nine feet (9') and made from
two inch by six inch (2" x 6"), 16-gauge cee or zee purlin.
      8.   Walkway Center: Minimum of one inch by four inch (1" x 4") box
tubing down the center of the walkway.
      9.   Mobile Walkway: Walkway should be made mobile as the water level
changes. Usually done by pivoting joints that connect to the boat dock and in
the middle of the walkway.
      10.   Storage Buildings: No storage buildings next to walkways are
authorized.
   C.   Boat Dock Construction Requirements:
      1.   Width: Maximum width thirty two feet (32') unless exception approved
by the city.
      2.   Length: Maximum length thirty two feet (32') unless exception
approved by the city.
      3.   Materials: Frame (undercarriage) constructed of four foot by eight
foot (4' x 8'), 16-gauge cee or zee purlin. Flooring made of two inch by six
inch (2" x 6") treated lumber or comparable metal or synthetic wood.
      4.   Flotation: Enclosed flotation must be provided under all areas of
the structure and be sufficient to support the structure, flooring and roof if
applicable. Minimum flotation size shall be four feet by four feet (4' x 4').
   D.   Roof: If a boat dock is constructed with a roof, the following
standards apply:
      1.   Materials: All materials must be metal.
      2.   Fastening: Roof must be securely fastened to the dock to resist wind
uplift.
      3.   Joists Or Rafters: Metal roof joists or rafters can be no more than
five feet six inches (5'6") center to center, and made of four inch by eight
inch (4" x 8") cee or zee purlin.
      4.   Vertical Supports: Vertical supports must be no more than five feet
six inches (5'6") center to center, and made of two inch (2") square metal
tubing.
      5.   Bolting: When attaching roof to vertical supports and boat dock,
bolting is preferred to welding.
   E.   Maintenance Of Boat Docks/Lake Access Structures:
      1.   Boat docks/lake access structures will be maintained in good repair
and a satisfactory condition so as not to be a nuisance, to adversely affect
the aesthetic appeal of the lake, to be detrimental or potentially detrimental
to the water quality, or to be unsafe for use. Whether a boat dock/lake access
structure is in good repair and satisfactory condition shall be determined by
an Okmulgee state park official and/or a city representative. If repairs are
required, the time allowed to make the required repairs to bring the boat dock/
lake access structure into good repair and a satisfactory condition will be
determined by a city representative and provided in writing to the owner.
Failure to make the required repairs shall result in revocation of the permit
as detailed in subsection
11.18.060C3 of this chapter.
      2.   The construction specifications addressed herein apply to new and
existing construction. All existing boat docks/lake access structures must be
maintained in a serviceable condition as determined by Okmulgee state park and/
or a city representative or be subject to revocation of the permit as detailed
in subsection
11.18.060C3 of this chapter. Furthermore, existing boat docks shall be given a
temporary permit for one year in order for the owner to make the improvements
necessary to meet the new construction specifications or said permit shall be
revoked per subsection
11.18.60C3 of this chapter.
   F.   Modification Of An Existing Structure After The Temporary Permit
Period:
      1.   In the event an existing permit holder desires to replace an
existing boat dock/lake access structure under these rules and regulations,
prior to doing so, the plans and specifications must be submitted to the
community development department for approval. Said plans and specifications
for the new structure must conform to the construction standards set out in
this section. In the event said proposed new construction shall exceed the
footprint of the previous structure, shall be positioned differently in the
same location or shall be installed in a new location, advance written approval
shall be required of the city of Okmulgee for said construction to be allowed
under the existing permit.
      2.   In the event an existing permit holder desires to relocate an
existing boat dock, advance approval of the city shall be required. Failure to
do so shall result in the city requiring the boat dock to be returned to the
original location or revocation of the permit.
   G.   Sales Of Land Or Lease Transfers: In the event a tract of real property
is sold or a lake lease from the city of Okmulgee is transferred, and the
seller or lessee holds a valid permit in good standing for an existing boat
dock, said permit may be transferred to the buyer or lessee of said tract of
real property only upon application to and written approval by the city. In the
event said permit is not in good standing (i.e., the boat dock is not in good
repair or satisfactory condition as detailed in subsection
11.18.070E1 of this chapter, the permit holder is delinquent in payment of
fees, etc.) the buyer shall have six (6) months to resolve any deficiencies or
face revocation of the permit as detailed in subsection
11.18.060C3 of this chapter. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.18.080: RIGHT OF INSPECTION:
Okmulgee state park or the city of Okmulgee shall have the right to investigate
and inspect all boat docks/lake access sites as often as they shall deem
necessary for the adequate supervision thereof and they shall have the right to
enter all such places at any reasonable time for the purpose of making such an
investigation. Acceptance of a permit shall constitute expressed consent to
such inspections. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)
11.18.090: PENALTY:
Any person who violates any provision of this chapter, shall be guilty of an
offense and, upon conviction, shall be fined as provided in section
1.12.010 of this code. (Ord. 1930 § 2, 2008)

CHAPTER 12.04
OPENINGS IN PAVEMENT
SECTION:
12.04.010: Permit Required; Bond And Fee
12.04.020: Cuts And Inspection
12.04.030: Standards For Fill And Closing
12.04.010: PERMIT REQUIRED; BOND AND FEE:
No person, firm or corporation shall open or make a cut in the surface of any
street, alley or sidewalk of the city without first obtaining a permit. The
city clerk or his/her designee shall issue the permit when:
   A.   The proposed cut has been approved in writing by the city inspector;
and
   B.   The applicant has furnished a performance bond of not less than ten
thousand dollars ($10,000.00); and
   C.   The applicant has paid a permit and inspection fee of thirty dollars
($30.00). (Ord. 1896 § 1, 2007)
12.04.020: CUTS AND INSPECTION:
In opening or making a cut in the surface of any street, alley or sidewalk, the
applicant shall saw through the permanent cap in such manner that the cap can
be removed without disturbing or causing damage in any manner to the
surrounding area. Prior to closing in the cut, approval of the city inspector
must be obtained. (Ord. 1896 § 2, 2007)
12.04.030: STANDARDS FOR FILL AND CLOSING:
The closing in shall be done by backfill with loose compactable material,
tamping the backfill after each six inches (6") of lift, to conform to Oklahoma
highway standards, to the base of the surrounding street cover. The city
inspector must approve the fill prior to capping. If the street is surfaced
with concrete, a paving cap of three thousand (3,000) pounds test concrete
shall be applied from the base to the driving surface at least a thickness of
eight inches (8") to conform to Oklahoma highway standards. If the street is
surfaced with an asphalt, a paving cap of three thousand (3,000) pounds test
concrete shall be applied from the base to within two inches (2") of the
driving surface at least a thickness of eight inches (8"), and a surface layer
of two inches (2") of type A asphalt shall be poured and compressed to bring
the surface of the cut area to the surface of the surrounding area and so
shaped as to not hold water in the area of the repair, all to conform to
Oklahoma highway standards. See the sample graphic.
[https://export.amlegal.com/media/24e66deb13fb7e5d0f09f9fa28a2c7ca82bef168/
IMAGES/0-0-0-26.gif]
(Ord. 1896 § 2, 2007)
CHAPTER 12.08
DRIVEWAY CONSTRUCTION
SECTION:
12.08.010: Permit Required
12.08.020: Application; City Of Okmulgee Approval Required
12.08.030: Plans And Specifications To Conform To State Highway Department
Regulations
12.08.040: Permit And Inspection Fee
12.08.050: Inspect All Work
12.08.010: PERMIT REQUIRED:
No person, firm or corporation shall hereafter construct, build, establish or
maintain any driveway over, across or upon any portion of the public sidewalk
or public parkway without a permit to do so from the city clerk or his/her
designee. No such permit shall be issued for construction or establishment of
any driveway except in accordance with the provisions contained in this
chapter. (Ord. 2210 § 1, 2024: Ord. 982 § 1, 1960)
12.08.020: APPLICATION; CITY OF OKMULGEE APPROVAL REQUIRED:
The city clerk or his/her designee shall not issue a permit hereunder until an
application has been received; therefore, duly approved by the City Manager's
designee. The application for permit must be made in writing upon forms
furnished by the city. The application shall contain the name and address of
the person, firm or corporation making the application, the name of the
contractor or person who is to construct the driveway, and the proposed
location and dimensions of such driveway. Plans and specifications shall be
attached to and made a part of the application. (Ord. 2210 § 1, 2024: Ord. 982
§ 2, 1960)
12.08.030: PLANS AND SPECIFICATIONS TO CONFORM TO STATE HIGHWAY DEPARTMENT
REGULATIONS:
The application shall not be approved unless the plans and specifications
submitted conform to the most current adopted "Standard Designs - Driveway
Entrances - For Oklahoma Highways", as prepared by the Oklahoma state highway
department. (Ord. 2210 § 1, 2024: Ord. 982 § 3, 1960)
12.08.040: PERMIT AND INSPECTION FEE:
Before work is started, the contractor or other person desiring a permit shall
pay to the city clerk or his/her designee a permit and inspection fee as
follows: for all driveway construction, the fee shall be fifty dollars ($50.00)
for a driveway of two hundred fifty (250) square feet or less; for a driveway
of more than two hundred fifty (250) square feet, the fee shall be fifty
dollars ($50.00) plus ten cents ($0.10) for each square foot over two hundred
fifty (250). (Ord. 2210 § 1, 2024: Ord. 1324 § 2, 1977: Ord. 982 § 4, 1960)
12.08.050: INSPECT ALL WORK:
All such work shall be done under the jurisdiction of the City Manager's
designee and in accordance with his/her requirements and subject to his/her
inspection at all times. (Ord. 2210 § 1, 2024: Ord. 982 § 5, 1960)
CHAPTER 12.12
LIMITED ACCESS FACILITIES
SECTION:
12.12.010: Definitions
12.12.020: System Established; Costs Declared To Be Of General Nature
12.12.030: All Streets And Avenues Included
12.12.040: Classification Of System
12.12.050: Use Regulated By Traffic Provisions
12.12.060: Zoning Provisions Not Affected
12.12.010: DEFINITIONS:
For the purpose of this chapter, the following terms shall be defined to mean
as follows:
ARTERIAL HIGHWAY: A street or highway especially designed for through traffic,
entrance into which, at intersections, is or may be limited by requiring all
entering vehicles to be brought to a complete stop.
AUXILIARY SERVICE HIGHWAY: A street or highway designed to furnish access to an
arterial highway.
LIMITED ACCESS FACILITY: Includes arterial highways and auxiliary service
highways. (Prior code § 624)
12.12.020: SYSTEM ESTABLISHED; COSTS DECLARED TO BE OF GENERAL NATURE:
A system of access facilities, consisting of the streets and avenues and parts
of streets and avenues described in this chapter, established and created
within the corporate limits of the city, and in recognition of the general use
of the streets and avenues included therein, and of the wear, tear and
destruction of the grading, drainage and improvements by heavy general traffic
passenger buses and bus routes, trucks and motor freight transportation, the
straightening, widening, grading, draining, paving, curbing, guttering, and
maintaining of the limited access facilities of the city, are declared to be
improvements of a general nature, and to the extent that the cost thereof
exceeds the benefits to the abutting property owners, such costs are declared
to be costs for improvements of a general nature, for the benefit of the entire
city. (Prior code § 625)
12.12.030: ALL STREETS AND AVENUES INCLUDED:
All streets and avenues within the corporate limits of the city are declared to
be limited access facilities and public utilities within the authority,
provisions, and definitions of senate bill no. 300 enacted at the regular
sessions of the twentieth Oklahoma legislature on April 18, 1945, and approved
by the governor on May 5, 1945. (Prior code § 626)
12.12.040: CLASSIFICATION OF SYSTEM:
The system of limited access facilities of the city is classified into arterial
highways and auxiliary service highways, as follows:
   A.   Arterial Highways: The following access facilities are declared to be
arterial highways:
      1.   Eufaula Street, from Oklahoma Avenue to Okmulgee Avenue; Okmulgee
Avenue, from Eufaula Street to Sixth Street;
      2.   Kern Avenue, from Fourth Street to Sixth Street;
      3.   Sixth Street, from Kern Avenue to Missions Road; Mission Road, from
Sixth Street to Fourth Street;
      4.   Muskogee Avenue, from Sixth Street to Thirteenth Street;
      5.   Thirteenth Street, from Muskogee Avenue to Choctaw Avenue; Choctaw
Avenue, from Thirteenth Street to Twentieth Street;
      6.   Fourth Street, from Kern Avenue to the west line of Okmulgee Avenue
and from the east line of Okmulgee Avenue to Central Avenue;
      7.   Central Avenue, from Fourth Street to Sixth Street.
   B.   Auxiliary Service Highways: All other parts and portions of the system
of limited access facilities not herein declared to be arterial highways are
declared to be auxiliary service highways. (Prior code § 627)
12.12.050: USE REGULATED BY TRAFFIC PROVISIONS:
Use of the limited access facilities of the city shall be regulated and
controlled by the traffic ordinances and parts of ordinances and amendments
thereto now in force or hereinafter enacted in the city. (Prior code § 628)
12.12.060: ZONING PROVISIONS NOT AFFECTED:
Nothing contained in this chapter shall be construed to affect any of the
zoning ordinances which are now or may hereafter be put in force in the city
regulating improvements on property abutting on limited access facilities
within the corporate limits of the city. (Prior code § 629)
CHAPTER 12.16
OBSTRUCTIONS OR DAMAGE PROHIBITED
SECTION:
12.16.010: Abutting Trees And Shrubs To Be Trimmed And/or Grass And Weeds To Be
Mowed
12.16.020: Failure To Trim Trees Or Shrubs Or Mow Grass Or Weeds; Violation
12.16.030: Injuring Trees Or Shrubs Unlawful
12.16.040: Obstructing Streets, Sidewalks; Exceptions
12.16.050: Interference With Pedestrians Or Traffic
12.16.060: Depositing Trash Or Refuse
12.16.070: Interference With Storm Sewers Or Drainage
12.16.080: Playing On Sidewalks Or In Streets
12.16.090: Washing Vehicles On Street Prohibited
12.16.100: Allowing Water Or Mud To Drain Onto Street
12.16.110: Allowing Water Or Grease From Service Stations Onto Street
12.16.120: Permitting Sidewalk Area To Become Hazard; Abutting Owner Liability
12.16.010: ABUTTING TREES AND SHRUBS TO BE TRIMMED AND/OR GRASS AND WEEDS TO BE
MOWED:
The owner, lessee, resident and/or occupant of any lot, premises, tract or
parcel of land abutting on any street, road, highway, alley or public way in
this city shall trim all trees and/or shrubbery and/or mow, cut and/or trim all
grass and/or weeds growing or located in the ditches, parking or other strip,
between the sidewalks and the roadway, or adjacent to the roadway, of any such
street, road, highway, alley or public way, and all trees, shrubbery and grass
and/or weeds growing or located on any part of the lot, premises, tract or
parcel of land adjacent to the roadway, sidewalks or any street, road, highway,
alley or public way, in such manner that the boughs, limbs, branches or foliage
of such trees and shrubbery shall not delay, limit, block, hinder or obstruct
free, safe and convenient passage, travel, vision or sight along such streets,
roads, highways, alleys and public ways. Such trees and shrubbery shall be
trimmed and/or cut so that the lowest boughs, limbs, branches or foliage shall
not be lower than fifteen feet (15') above the roadway of the street, road,
highway or alley, nor lower than ten feet (10') above a sidewalk, and grass and
weeds shall be mowed, cut and/or trimmed and shall at no time be allowed by the
owner, lessee, resident and/or occupant to exceed a height of eight inches
(8"). (Ord. 1741 § 1, 1999: prior code § 631)
12.16.020: FAILURE TO TRIM TREES OR SHRUBS OR MOW GRASS AND WEEDS; VIOLATION:
Any owner, lessee, resident and/or occupant of any lot, premises, tract or
parcel of land who fails, refuses or neglects to trim and/or cut trees and/or
shrubbery and/or mow, cut and/or trim grass and/or weeds as provided in section
12.16.010 of this chapter, is guilty of an offense against the city and each
and every day that the owner, lessee, resident and/or occupant fails, refuses
or neglects to trim and/or cut trees and/or shrubbery and/or to mow, cut and/or
trim grass and/or weeds, shall constitute a separate offense. (Ord. 1741 § 2,
1999: prior code § 632)
12.16.030: INJURING TREES OR SHRUBS UNLAWFUL:
It is unlawful for any person to injure any tree or shrubbery on a street or
alley in the city; provided that this shall not prohibit the lawful and proper
care and removal of such trees and shrubbery. (Prior code § 633)
12.16.040: OBSTRUCTING STREETS, SIDEWALKS; EXCEPTIONS:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to place upon or permit to
be placed upon the sidewalks, parkways, streets and alleys of the city any
goods, wares, articles of merchandise or any other obstructions, except that
any retailer of same operating a business in a commercial district may exhibit
and sell merchandise upon the sidewalks, parkways, streets and alleys of the
city directly adjacent to said retailer's business, if said retailer has
complied with the following conditions:
   A.   Said retailer has in full force and effect a policy of public liability
insurance in amounts at least equal to those amounts prescribed for liability
in the Oklahoma political subdivisions tort claims act; and
   B.   Such goods, wares, or articles of merchandise shall be placed as near
to the building as possible and in no event shall same be placed or exhibited
within a distance of sixty inches (60") of the curb line. (Ord. 1680 § 1, 1992;
prior code § 634)
12.16.050: INTERFERENCE WITH PEDESTRIANS OR TRAFFIC:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to use or obstruct the
sidewalks of the city in any manner so as to interfere unduly with pedestrian
traffic thereon, or to use or obstruct the streets and alleys of the city in
any manner so as to interfere unduly with lawful traffic and parking thereon.
(Prior code § 635)
12.16.060: DEPOSITING TRASH OR REFUSE:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to deposit, throw or sweep
into or upon the streets, alleys, parking strip or sidewalks of the city any
paper, rubbish, grass, weeds, tree trimmings, dirt, trash, crates, boxes or
other refuse of any kind. (Prior code § 636)
12.16.070: INTERFERENCE WITH STORM SEWERS OR DRAINAGE:
It is unlawful for any person, firm or corporation to obstruct any street,
sidewalk or alley within the city by placing any approach driveway or other
obstruction or substance whatever that will obstruct or prevent the natural
flow of water into the storm sewers or drains or dam the same so as to back any
water upon the streets, alleys, sidewalks or gutters. (Prior code § 637)
12.16.080: PLAYING ON SIDEWALKS OR IN STREETS:
It is unlawful for any person to play on the sidewalks or upon the main
travelled portion of the streets and alleys of the city, except as may be
authorized by ordinance. (Prior code § 638)
12.16.090: WASHING VEHICLES ON STREET PROHIBITED:
The washing of an automobile or other vehicle in any street of the city is
prohibited. (Prior code § 639)
12.16.100: ALLOWING WATER OR MUD TO DRAIN ONTO STREET:
No automobile or other vehicle shall be washed at any place within the city
where the water, dirt, mud or other substances removed therefrom by or during
the washing thereof, shall drain into or upon any street of the city. (Prior
code § 640)
12.16.110: ALLOWING WATER OR GREASE FROM SERVICE STATIONS ONTO STREET:
It is unlawful for any owner or operator of a filling station or other place of
business, or any agent or employee thereof, to cause or allow water, grease or
other fluid to flow or drain into, upon, over or across any sidewalk, parking,
street, alley or other public way. (Prior code § 641)
12.16.120: PERMITTING SIDEWALK AREA TO BECOME HAZARD; ABUTTING OWNER LIABILITY:
It is unlawful for the owner of property abutting upon a sidewalk or sidewalk
area to permit the sidewalk or sidewalk area adjacent to the property to become
a hazard to persons using the sidewalk or sidewalk area. (Prior code § 642)
CHAPTER 12.20
CLOSING OF STREETS
SECTION:
12.20.010: Definitions
12.20.020: Authority To Close Streets
12.20.030: Procedure For Closing Street; Fee
12.20.040: Contents Of Application
12.20.050: Notice Of Hearing
12.20.060: Form Of Notice
12.20.070: Effect Of Closing; Right To Reopen
12.20.010: DEFINITIONS:
In this chapter, unless the context requires otherwise:
CLOSE: A legislative act of the city council discontinuing the public use of a
public way or easement without affecting title to real property.
EASEMENT: Rights in real property as set forth in 60 Oklahoma Statutes section
49.
PUBLIC WAY: A street, avenue, boulevard, alley, lane or thoroughfare open for
public use. (Ord. 1341 § 1, 1978)
12.20.020: AUTHORITY TO CLOSE STREETS:
The city council shall have the power by ordinance to close to public use any
public way or easement within the city whenever the city council deems such
closing necessary or expedient. (Ord. 1341 § 1, 1978)
12.20.030: PROCEDURE FOR CLOSING STREET; FEE:
   A.   Any property owner owning property abutting a public way or easement
may make application to the city clerk to close said public way or easement;
said application shall be made upon forms furnished by the city clerk, and
shall be accompanied by an application fee of twenty five dollars ($25.00).
   B.   The city council may, upon its own motion, direct the filing of an
application to close a public way or easement, and in such case no application
fee shall be required. The city clerk shall prepare such application. (Ord.
1341 § 1, 1978)
12.20.040: CONTENTS OF APPLICATION:
The application shall set forth the name and address of the party making
application, the proper description of the public way or easement which is
sought to be closed, and the reason for which closing is sought. The
application shall set forth the names and mailing addresses of the following:
   A.   All public service corporations, transmission companies or franchise
holders having rights in said public way or easement;
   B.   All owners of record, as shown by the current year's tax rolls in the
office of the Okmulgee County treasurer, of property abutting the public way or
easement;
   C.   Any person, firm or corporation known to the applicant that may be
claiming an interest in said public way or easement. (Ord. 1341 § 1, 1978)
12.20.050: NOTICE OF HEARING:
Upon the filing of an application, the city clerk shall set the application for
hearing before the city council. The city clerk shall give notice of the
hearing by certified mail to all persons, firms or corporations listed on the
application, at least thirty (30) days prior to the date of the city council
meeting at which said application shall be heard. The city clerk shall give
notice to the public by publishing a notice of said application one time in a
legal newspaper published in the city at least ten (10) days prior to the
hearing. (Ord. 1389 § 1, 1980: Ord. 1341 § 1, 1978)
12.20.060: FORM OF NOTICE:
The notice shall be in the following form:
   NOTICE
   THE CITY OF OKMULGEE
   TO
      
Please take notice that an application has been filed with the City of Okmulgee
to close the following public way
   (description)
and that said application will be presented to, and acted upon, by the City
Council at its regular meeting to be held on (date) at 7:00 o'clock p.m. at the
Council chambers in the City Hall.
If you wish to be heard on this application you should appear before the City
Council at the time and place set out above.
You are further advised that the City Council may put off or continue hearing
or consideration of said application from time to time as the City Council may
in chamber direct.
You are further advised that if said public way be closed the City shall retain
the right to reopen the public way, and that the closing shall not affect the
right to maintain, repair, reconstruct, operate or remove utility, public
service corporation, or transmission company facilities of service therein, nor
shall such closing affect private ways existing by operation of law unless
released in writing executed by the owners thereof.
Dated this           day of                     20        .
            
      CITY CLERK
(Ord. 1341 § 1, 1978)
12.20.070: EFFECT OF CLOSING; RIGHT TO REOPEN:
   A.   In the event any public way or easement is closed by the city council
by ordinance, the city shall retain the absolute right to reopen the public way
or easement without expense to the city and may reopen:
      1.   By motion of the city council; or
      2.   Upon application of the property owners owning more than one-half
(1/2) in area of the property abutting on the public way or easement previously
closed.
   B.   The closing of a public way or easement shall not affect the right to
maintain, repair, reconstruct, operate or remove utility, public service
corporation or transmission company facilities of service therein, unless
released in writing executed by the owners thereof. (Ord. 1341 § 1, 1978)
CHAPTER 12.22
ONE-WAY STREETS

12.22.010: ONE-WAY STREET; 7TH STREET BETWEEN SEMINOLE AVENUE AND OKMULGEE
AVENUE:
The portion of 7th Street between Seminole Avenue and Okmulgee Avenue is hereby
designated to be a one-way street and all vehicular traffic thereon shall
travel only from east to west. The city manager is expressly authorized to post
appropriate signage at this location signifying such designation as a one-way
street. (Ord. 1769 § 1, 2001)

AVENUE:
The portion of 7th Street between Okmulgee Avenue and Alabama Avenue, is hereby
designated to be a one-way street and all vehicular traffic thereon shall
travel only from east to west. The city manager is expressly authorized to post
appropriate signage at this location signifying such designation as a one-way
street. (Ord. 2088, 2016)
CHAPTER 12.26
INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS; USE AND FUNDING
SECTION:
12.26.010: Preconditions For Use
12.26.020: Temporary Political Signage
12.26.030: Permit And Conditions
12.26.040: Signage Dimensions And Locations
12.26.050: Temporary Event Signage For Nonprofits
12.26.010: PRECONDITIONS FOR USE:
   A.   The city of Okmulgee is hereafter making certain improvements to
publicly owned real property at the Okmulgee Regional Airport, including the
construction of new roadways and drives, improvements to the water distribution
system and the sanitary sewer collection system, and resurfacing of a portion
of an airport runway. These improvements are funded in part by community
development block grant - economic development infrastructure (CDBG-EDIF)
funds. To comply with federal requirements and conditions of the CDBG program,
any business entity seeking to make use of such facilities shall be required to
submit a written statement that they will provide to the city of Okmulgee job
tracking data on any and all jobs created after or existing on the date that
they apply for use of the facilities. No connections to or use of the
facilities shall be allowed unless the written statement is submitted.
   B.   As used herein, job tracking data shall include a listing of the types
of jobs existing or projected at that business location, the number of jobs in
each of the various job types, whether the jobs are full time or part time,
gross salary or projected wage numbers in a format that conceals the identity
of the employee, and the duration of the job if it is expected to last less
than one year. Job tracking data shall be provided quarterly from the date of
first occupation of any portion of the airport property, and ending not earlier
than one year after the completion of construction of the last improvement that
is funded in this project with CDBG-EDIF funds. If the data is not provided,
and the default is not corrected within thirty (30) days after the city of
Okmulgee makes a written request, the city shall discontinue utility service or
otherwise deny access to the improvements until the data is provided. If the
discontinuance of utility service would create a threat to human life or
health, the city of Okmulgee may allow the minimum service necessary to avoid
the threat to human life or health, but discontinue other services and deny
other uses of the facilities until compliance is achieved. (Ord. 1876 § 1,
2006)
12.26.020: TEMPORARY POLITICAL SIGNAGE:
It is hereby prohibited for any person or entity to place or to authorize the
placement of any temporary political signs in any form, within the public right
of way for any street, alley, sidewalk or bike lane, except as provided for
herein. It is hereby prohibited for any person or entity to place any signs in
any form, within the public right of way for any state or federal highway; in
the event that the right of way includes both a highway and a sidewalk or bike
lane, the prohibition as to rights of way for highways shall control. (Ord.
1990, 2012)
12.26.030: PERMIT AND CONDITIONS:
   A.   During any year preceding a local, state, or federal election, any
person owning or possessing any interest in the real estate immediately
abutting the right of way for a public street, alley, sidewalk or bike lane,
but excluding any right of way for any state or federal highway, may apply for
a permit to place a temporary political sign containing its own physical
support on the right of way. No person shall place or authorize the placement
of a private signage on any utility pole or other structure, or placed in the
median. No person may attach such a sign to any traffic signage or control
device, or to any tree.
   B.   Applicant, whether acting as the adjacent landowner, or as an official
representative of a campaign which has previously obtained permission of the
adjacent landowner, shall apply to the community development department by
submitting a nonrefundable twenty dollar ($20.00) permit fee and completing an
application form available from the community development department. The
application shall also include a one hundred dollar ($100.00) deposit for
permits to be used during primaries and all local (city and county) elections,
or a one hundred dollar ($100.00) deposit for state or national general
elections. This deposit is refundable if the requirements of this section and
section
12.26.040 of this chapter are fully met by the applicant.
   C.   No signage shall be allowed on the rights of way adjacent to vacant
lots. Only one sign per block of developed, commercial or industrial use. Only
one sign per one-half (1/2) mile of undeveloped agricultural land. (Ord. 2064,
2015: Ord. 1990, 2012)
12.26.040: SIGNAGE DIMENSIONS AND LOCATIONS:
   A.   Each sign permitted under this chapter must be not more than four (4)
square feet in area, and placed no higher than thirty six inches (36") from the
ground. No portion of the sign may be placed at less than eight feet (8') from
the edge of any street or alley or less than one foot (1') from any sidewalk or
bike lane.
   B.   Signs may be placed by the applicant no earlier than forty five (45)
calendar days prior to an election and must be removed by the applicant within
ten (10) calendar days following the election. In the event of a contested
election, or runoff, the sign shall be removed within ten (10) days following
the resolution of the contest or the runoff as applicable.
   C.   All signs placed under a permit shall be maintained by the applicant.
(Ord. 1990, 2012)
12.26.050: TEMPORARY EVENT SIGNAGE FOR NONPROFITS:
The provisions of sections
12.26.020, 12.26.030 and 12.26.040 of this chapter shall also apply to allow
temporary signage for public events and announcements for nonprofit
organizations within the city of Okmulgee. Provided, however, the permit shall
be at no cost to the nonprofit organization and the deposit may be waived by
the city manager upon application. Failure of the nonprofit to abide by
previous permits or remove signs after event shall be grounds to deny waiver of
the deposit. The nonprofit applicant shall submit state approval as a nonprofit
entity along with the permit application, unless it is a school, religious
association or community organization functioning within the city of Okmulgee
for more than one year prior to the application. The event or announcement
contained in the sign must be open to the public. The time frames set forth in
the foregoing sections pertaining to "elections" shall be deemed to be
pertaining to the "event", if there is not a specified date, the permit shall
be valid up to a maximum of ninety (90) days from the date of the permit. (Ord.
2091, 2016)

CHAPTER 13.04
WATER SERVICE
SECTION:
